  65class TramDagModel:
  66    """
  67    Probabilistic DAG model built from node-wise TRAMs (transformation models).
  68
  69    This class manages:
  70    - Configuration and per-node model construction.
  71    - Data scaling (minâ€“max).
  72    - Training (sequential or per-node parallel on CPU).
  73    - Diagnostics (loss history, intercepts, linear shifts, latents).
  74    - Sampling from the joint DAG and loading stored samples.
  75    - High-level summaries and plotting utilities.
  76    """
  77    
  78    # ---- defaults used at construction time ----
  79    DEFAULTS_CONFIG = {
  80        "set_initial_weights": False,
  81        "debug":False,
  82        "verbose": False,
  83        "device":'auto',
  84        "initial_data":None,
  85        "overwrite_initial_weights": True,
  86    }
  87
  88    # ---- defaults used at fit() time ----
  89    DEFAULTS_FIT = {
  90        "epochs": 100,
  91        "train_list": None,
  92        "callbacks": None,
  93        "learning_rate": 0.01,
  94        "device": "auto",
  95        "optimizers": None,
  96        "schedulers": None,
  97        "use_scheduler": False,
  98        "save_linear_shifts": True,
  99        "save_simple_intercepts": True,
 100        "debug":False,
 101        "verbose": True,
 102        "train_mode": "sequential",  # or "parallel"
 103        "return_history": False,
 104        "overwrite_inital_weights": True,
 105        "num_workers" : 4,
 106        "persistent_workers" : True,
 107        "prefetch_factor" : 4,
 108        "batch_size":1000,
 109        
 110    }
 111
 112    def __init__(self):
 113        """
 114        Initialize an empty TramDagModel shell.
 115
 116        Notes
 117        -----
 118        This constructor does not build any node models and does not attach a
 119        configuration. Use `TramDagModel.from_config` or `TramDagModel.from_directory`
 120        to obtain a fully configured and ready-to-use instance.
 121        """
 122        
 123        self.debug = False
 124        self.verbose = False
 125        self.device = 'auto'
 126        pass
 127
 128    @staticmethod
 129    def get_device(settings):
 130        """
 131        Resolve the target device string from a settings dictionary.
 132
 133        Parameters
 134        ----------
 135        settings : dict
 136            Dictionary containing at least a key ``"device"`` with one of
 137            {"auto", "cpu", "cuda"}. If missing, "auto" is assumed.
 138
 139        Returns
 140        -------
 141        str
 142            Device string, either "cpu" or "cuda".
 143
 144        Notes
 145        -----
 146        If ``device == "auto"``, CUDA is selected if available, otherwise CPU.
 147        """
 148        device_arg = settings.get("device", "auto")
 149        if device_arg == "auto":
 150            device_str = "cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu"
 151        else:
 152            device_str = device_arg
 153        return device_str
 154
 155    def _validate_kwargs(self, kwargs: dict, defaults_attr: str = "DEFAULTS_FIT", context: str = None):
 156        """
 157        Validate a kwargs dictionary against a class-level defaults dictionary.
 158
 159        Parameters
 160        ----------
 161        kwargs : dict
 162            Keyword arguments to validate.
 163        defaults_attr : str, optional
 164            Name of the attribute on this class that contains the allowed keys,
 165            e.g. ``"DEFAULTS_CONFIG"`` or ``"DEFAULTS_FIT"``. Default is "DEFAULTS_FIT".
 166        context : str or None, optional
 167            Optional label (e.g. caller name) to prepend in error messages.
 168
 169        Raises
 170        ------
 171        AttributeError
 172            If the attribute named by ``defaults_attr`` does not exist.
 173        ValueError
 174            If any key in ``kwargs`` is not present in the corresponding defaults dict.
 175        """
 176        defaults = getattr(self, defaults_attr, None)
 177        if defaults is None:
 178            raise AttributeError(f"{self.__class__.__name__} has no attribute '{defaults_attr}'")
 179
 180        unknown = set(kwargs) - set(defaults)
 181        if unknown:
 182            prefix = f"[{context}] " if context else ""
 183            raise ValueError(f"{prefix}Unknown parameter(s): {', '.join(sorted(unknown))}")
 184            
 185    ## CREATE A TRAMDADMODEL
 186    @classmethod
 187    def from_config(cls, cfg, **kwargs):
 188        """
 189        Construct a TramDagModel from a TramDagConfig object.
 190
 191        This builds one TRAM model per node in the DAG and optionally writes
 192        the initial model parameters to disk.
 193
 194        Parameters
 195        ----------
 196        cfg : TramDagConfig
 197            Configuration wrapper holding the underlying configuration dictionary,
 198            including at least:
 199            - ``conf_dict["nodes"]``: mapping of node names to node configs.
 200            - ``conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]``: experiment directory.
 201        **kwargs
 202            Node-level construction options. Each key must be present in
 203            ``DEFAULTS_CONFIG``. Values can be:
 204            - scalar: applied to all nodes.
 205            - dict: mapping ``{node_name: value}`` for per-node overrides.
 206
 207            Common keys include:
 208            device : {"auto", "cpu", "cuda"}, default "auto"
 209                Device selection (CUDA if available when "auto").
 210            debug : bool, default False
 211                If True, print debug messages.
 212            verbose : bool, default False
 213                If True, print informational messages.
 214            set_initial_weights : bool
 215                Passed to underlying TRAM model constructors.
 216            overwrite_initial_weights : bool, default True
 217                If True, overwrite any existing ``initial_model.pt`` files per node.
 218            initial_data : Any
 219                Optional object passed down to node constructors.
 220
 221        Returns
 222        -------
 223        TramDagModel
 224            Fully initialized instance with:
 225            - ``cfg``
 226            - ``nodes_dict``
 227            - ``models`` (per-node TRAMs)
 228            - ``settings`` (resolved per-node config)
 229
 230        Raises
 231        ------
 232        ValueError
 233            If any dict-valued kwarg does not provide values for exactly the set
 234            of nodes in ``cfg.conf_dict["nodes"]``.
 235        """
 236        
 237        self = cls()
 238        self.cfg = cfg
 239        self.cfg.update()  # ensure latest version from disk
 240        self.cfg._verify_completeness()
 241        
 242        
 243        try:
 244            self.cfg.save()  # persist back to disk
 245            if getattr(self, "debug", False):
 246                print("[DEBUG] Configuration updated and saved.")
 247        except Exception as e:
 248            print(f"[WARNING] Could not save configuration after update: {e}")        
 249            
 250        self.nodes_dict = self.cfg.conf_dict["nodes"] 
 251
 252        self._validate_kwargs(kwargs, defaults_attr='DEFAULTS_CONFIG', context="from_config")
 253
 254        # update defaults with kwargs
 255        settings = dict(cls.DEFAULTS_CONFIG)
 256        settings.update(kwargs)
 257
 258        # resolve device
 259        device_arg = settings.get("device", "auto")
 260        if device_arg == "auto":
 261            device_str = "cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu"
 262        else:
 263            device_str = device_arg
 264        self.device = torch.device(device_str)
 265
 266        # set flags on the instance so they are accessible later
 267        self.debug = settings.get("debug", False)
 268        self.verbose = settings.get("verbose", False)
 269
 270        if  self.debug:
 271            print(f"[DEBUG] TramDagModel using device: {self.device}")
 272            
 273        # initialize settings storage
 274        self.settings = {k: {} for k in settings.keys()}
 275
 276        # validate dict-typed args
 277        for k, v in settings.items():
 278            if isinstance(v, dict):
 279                expected = set(self.nodes_dict.keys())
 280                given = set(v.keys())
 281                if expected != given:
 282                    raise ValueError(
 283                        f"[ERROR] the provided argument '{k}' keys are not same as in cfg.conf_dict['nodes'].keys().\n"
 284                        f"Expected: {expected}, but got: {given}\n"
 285                        f"Please provide values for all variables.")
 286
 287        # build one model per node
 288        self.models = {}
 289        for node in self.nodes_dict.keys():
 290            per_node_kwargs = {}
 291            for k, v in settings.items():
 292                resolved = v[node] if isinstance(v, dict) else v
 293                per_node_kwargs[k] = resolved
 294                self.settings[k][node] = resolved
 295            if self.debug:
 296                print(f"\n[INFO] Building model for node '{node}' with settings: {per_node_kwargs}")
 297            self.models[node] = get_fully_specified_tram_model(
 298                node=node,
 299                configuration_dict=self.cfg.conf_dict,
 300                **per_node_kwargs)
 301            
 302            try:
 303                EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 304                NODE_DIR = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, f"{node}")
 305                os.makedirs(NODE_DIR, exist_ok=True)
 306
 307                model_path = os.path.join(NODE_DIR, "initial_model.pt")
 308                overwrite = settings.get("overwrite_initial_weights", True)
 309
 310                if overwrite or not os.path.exists(model_path):
 311                    torch.save(self.models[node].state_dict(), model_path)
 312                    if self.debug:
 313                        print(f"[DEBUG] Saved initial model state for node '{node}' to {model_path} (overwrite={overwrite})")
 314                else:
 315                    if self.debug:
 316                        print(f"[DEBUG] Skipped saving initial model for node '{node}' (already exists at {model_path})")
 317            except Exception as e:
 318                print(f"[ERROR] Could not save initial model state for node '{node}': {e}")
 319            
 320            TEMP_DIR = "temp"
 321            if os.path.isdir(TEMP_DIR) and not os.listdir(TEMP_DIR):
 322                os.rmdir(TEMP_DIR)
 323                            
 324        return self
 325
 326    @classmethod
 327    def from_directory(cls, EXPERIMENT_DIR: str, device: str = "auto", debug: bool = False, verbose: bool = False):
 328        """
 329        Reconstruct a TramDagModel from an experiment directory on disk.
 330
 331        This method:
 332        1. Loads the configuration JSON.
 333        2. Wraps it in a TramDagConfig.
 334        3. Builds all node models via `from_config`.
 335        4. Loads the minâ€“max scaling dictionary.
 336
 337        Parameters
 338        ----------
 339        EXPERIMENT_DIR : str
 340            Path to an experiment directory containing:
 341            - ``configuration.json``
 342            - ``min_max_scaling.json``.
 343        device : {"auto", "cpu", "cuda"}, optional
 344            Device selection. Default is "auto".
 345        debug : bool, optional
 346            If True, enable debug messages. Default is False.
 347        verbose : bool, optional
 348            If True, enable informational messages. Default is False.
 349
 350        Returns
 351        -------
 352        TramDagModel
 353            A TramDagModel instance with models, config, and scaling loaded.
 354
 355        Raises
 356        ------
 357        FileNotFoundError
 358            If configuration or minâ€“max files cannot be found.
 359        RuntimeError
 360            If the minâ€“max file cannot be read or parsed.
 361        """
 362
 363        # --- load config file ---
 364        config_path = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, "configuration.json")
 365        if not os.path.exists(config_path):
 366            raise FileNotFoundError(f"[ERROR] Config file not found at {config_path}")
 367
 368        with open(config_path, "r") as f:
 369            cfg_dict = json.load(f)
 370
 371        # Create TramConfig wrapper 
 372        cfg = TramDagConfig(cfg_dict, CONF_DICT_PATH=config_path)
 373
 374        # --- build model from config ---
 375        self = cls.from_config(cfg, device=device, debug=debug, verbose=verbose, overwrite_initial_weights=False)
 376
 377        # --- load minmax scaling ---
 378        minmax_path = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, "min_max_scaling.json")
 379        if not os.path.exists(minmax_path):
 380            raise FileNotFoundError(f"[ERROR] MinMax file not found at {minmax_path}")
 381
 382        with open(minmax_path, "r") as f:
 383            self.minmax_dict = json.load(f)
 384
 385        if self.verbose or self.debug:
 386            print(f"[INFO] Loaded TramDagModel from {EXPERIMENT_DIR}")
 387            print(f"[INFO] Config loaded from {config_path}")
 388            print(f"[INFO] MinMax scaling loaded from {minmax_path}")
 389
 390        return self
 391
 392    def _ensure_dataset(self, data, is_val=False,**kwargs):
 393        """
 394        Ensure that the input data is represented as a TramDagDataset.
 395
 396        Parameters
 397        ----------
 398        data : pandas.DataFrame, TramDagDataset, or None
 399            Input data to be converted or passed through.
 400        is_val : bool, optional
 401            If True, the resulting dataset is treated as validation data
 402            (e.g. no shuffling). Default is False.
 403        **kwargs
 404            Additional keyword arguments passed through to
 405            ``TramDagDataset.from_dataframe``.
 406
 407        Returns
 408        -------
 409        TramDagDataset or None
 410            A TramDagDataset if ``data`` is a DataFrame or TramDagDataset,
 411            otherwise None if ``data`` is None.
 412
 413        Raises
 414        ------
 415        TypeError
 416            If ``data`` is not a DataFrame, TramDagDataset, or None.
 417        """
 418                
 419        if isinstance(data, pd.DataFrame):
 420            return TramDagDataset.from_dataframe(data, self.cfg, shuffle=not is_val,**kwargs)
 421        elif isinstance(data, TramDagDataset):
 422            return data
 423        elif data is None:
 424            return None
 425        else:
 426            raise TypeError(
 427                f"[ERROR] data must be pd.DataFrame, TramDagDataset, or None, got {type(data)}"
 428            )
 429
 430    def load_or_compute_minmax(self, td_train_data=None,use_existing=False, write=True):
 431        """
 432        Load an existing Minâ€“Max scaling dictionary from disk or compute a new one 
 433        from the provided training dataset.
 434
 435        Parameters
 436        ----------
 437        use_existing : bool, optional (default=False)
 438            If True, attempts to load an existing `min_max_scaling.json` file 
 439            from the experiment directory. Raises an error if the file is missing 
 440            or unreadable.
 441
 442        write : bool, optional (default=True)
 443            If True, writes the computed Minâ€“Max scaling dictionary to 
 444            `<EXPERIMENT_DIR>/min_max_scaling.json`.
 445
 446        td_train_data : object, optional
 447            Training dataset used to compute scaling statistics. If not provided,
 448            the method will ensure or construct it via `_ensure_dataset(data=..., is_val=False)`.
 449
 450        Behavior
 451        --------
 452        - If `use_existing=True`, loads the JSON file containing previously saved 
 453          minâ€“max values and stores it in `self.minmax_dict`.
 454        - If `use_existing=False`, computes a new scaling dictionary using 
 455          `td_train_data.compute_scaling()` and stores the result in 
 456          `self.minmax_dict`.
 457        - Optionally writes the computed dictionary to disk.
 458
 459        Side Effects
 460        -------------
 461        - Populates `self.minmax_dict` with scaling values.
 462        - Writes or loads the file `min_max_scaling.json` under 
 463          `<EXPERIMENT_DIR>`.
 464        - Prints diagnostic output if `self.debug` or `self.verbose` is True.
 465
 466        Raises
 467        ------
 468        FileNotFoundError
 469            If `use_existing=True` but the minâ€“max file does not exist.
 470
 471        RuntimeError
 472            If an existing minâ€“max file cannot be read or parsed.
 473
 474        Notes
 475        -----
 476        The computed minâ€“max dictionary is expected to contain scaling statistics 
 477        per feature, typically in the form:
 478            {
 479                "node": {"min": float, "max": float},
 480                ...
 481            }
 482        """
 483        EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 484        minmax_path = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, "min_max_scaling.json")
 485
 486        # laod exisitng if possible
 487        if use_existing:
 488            if not os.path.exists(minmax_path):
 489                raise FileNotFoundError(f"MinMax file not found: {minmax_path}")
 490            try:
 491                with open(minmax_path, 'r') as f:
 492                    self.minmax_dict = json.load(f)
 493                if self.debug or self.verbose:
 494                    print(f"[INFO] Loaded existing minmax dict from {minmax_path}")
 495                return
 496            except Exception as e:
 497                raise RuntimeError(f"Could not load existing minmax dict: {e}")
 498
 499        # 
 500        if self.debug or self.verbose:
 501            print("[INFO] Computing new minmax dict from training data...")
 502            
 503        td_train_data=self._ensure_dataset( data=td_train_data, is_val=False)    
 504            
 505        self.minmax_dict = td_train_data.compute_scaling()
 506
 507        if write:
 508            os.makedirs(EXPERIMENT_DIR, exist_ok=True)
 509            with open(minmax_path, 'w') as f:
 510                json.dump(self.minmax_dict, f, indent=4)
 511            if self.debug or self.verbose:
 512                print(f"[INFO] Saved new minmax dict to {minmax_path}")
 513
 514    ## FIT METHODS
 515    @staticmethod
 516    def _fit_single_node(node, self_ref, settings, td_train_data, td_val_data, device_str):
 517        """
 518        Train a single node model (helper for per-node training).
 519
 520        This method is designed to be called either from the main process
 521        (sequential training) or from a joblib worker (parallel CPU training).
 522
 523        Parameters
 524        ----------
 525        node : str
 526            Name of the target node to train.
 527        self_ref : TramDagModel
 528            Reference to the TramDagModel instance containing models and config.
 529        settings : dict
 530            Training settings dictionary, typically derived from ``DEFAULTS_FIT``
 531            plus any user overrides.
 532        td_train_data : TramDagDataset
 533            Training dataset with node-specific DataLoaders in ``.loaders``.
 534        td_val_data : TramDagDataset or None
 535            Validation dataset or None.
 536        device_str : str
 537            Device string, e.g. "cpu" or "cuda".
 538
 539        Returns
 540        -------
 541        tuple
 542            A tuple ``(node, history)`` where:
 543            node : str
 544                Node name.
 545            history : dict or Any
 546                Training history as returned by ``train_val_loop``.
 547        """
 548        torch.set_num_threads(1)  # prevent thread oversubscription
 549
 550        model = self_ref.models[node]
 551
 552        # Resolve per-node settings
 553        def _resolve(key):
 554            val = settings[key]
 555            return val[node] if isinstance(val, dict) else val
 556
 557        node_epochs = _resolve("epochs")
 558        node_lr = _resolve("learning_rate")
 559        node_debug = _resolve("debug")
 560        node_save_linear_shifts = _resolve("save_linear_shifts")
 561        save_simple_intercepts  = _resolve("save_simple_intercepts")
 562        node_verbose = _resolve("verbose")
 563
 564        # Optimizer & scheduler
 565        if settings["optimizers"] and node in settings["optimizers"]:
 566            optimizer = settings["optimizers"][node]
 567        else:
 568            optimizer = Adam(model.parameters(), lr=node_lr)
 569
 570        scheduler = settings["schedulers"].get(node, None) if settings["schedulers"] else None
 571
 572        # Data loaders
 573        train_loader = td_train_data.loaders[node]
 574        val_loader = td_val_data.loaders[node] if td_val_data else None
 575
 576        # Min-max scaling tensors
 577        min_vals = torch.tensor(self_ref.minmax_dict[node][0], dtype=torch.float32)
 578        max_vals = torch.tensor(self_ref.minmax_dict[node][1], dtype=torch.float32)
 579        min_max = torch.stack([min_vals, max_vals], dim=0)
 580
 581        # Node directory
 582        try:
 583            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self_ref.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 584            NODE_DIR = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, f"{node}")
 585        except Exception:
 586            NODE_DIR = os.path.join("models", node)
 587            print("[WARNING] No log directory specified in config, saving to default location.")
 588        os.makedirs(NODE_DIR, exist_ok=True)
 589
 590        if node_verbose:
 591            print(f"\n[INFO] Training node '{node}' for {node_epochs} epochs on {device_str} (pid={os.getpid()})")
 592
 593        # --- train ---
 594        history = train_val_loop(
 595            node=node,
 596            target_nodes=self_ref.nodes_dict,
 597            NODE_DIR=NODE_DIR,
 598            tram_model=model,
 599            train_loader=train_loader,
 600            val_loader=val_loader,
 601            epochs=node_epochs,
 602            optimizer=optimizer,
 603            use_scheduler=(scheduler is not None),
 604            scheduler=scheduler,
 605            save_linear_shifts=node_save_linear_shifts,
 606            save_simple_intercepts=save_simple_intercepts,
 607            verbose=node_verbose,
 608            device=torch.device(device_str),
 609            debug=node_debug,
 610            min_max=min_max)
 611        return node, history
 612
 613    def fit(self, train_data, val_data=None, **kwargs):
 614        """
 615        Train TRAM models for all nodes in the DAG.
 616
 617        Coordinates dataset preparation, minâ€“max scaling, and per-node training,
 618        optionally in parallel on CPU.
 619
 620        Parameters
 621        ----------
 622        train_data : pandas.DataFrame or TramDagDataset
 623            Training data. If a DataFrame is given, it is converted into a
 624            TramDagDataset using `_ensure_dataset`.
 625        val_data : pandas.DataFrame or TramDagDataset or None, optional
 626            Validation data. If a DataFrame is given, it is converted into a
 627            TramDagDataset. If None, no validation loss is computed.
 628        **kwargs
 629            Overrides for ``DEFAULTS_FIT``. All keys must exist in
 630            ``DEFAULTS_FIT``. Common options:
 631
 632            epochs : int, default 100
 633                Number of training epochs per node.
 634            learning_rate : float, default 0.01
 635                Learning rate for the default Adam optimizer.
 636            train_list : list of str or None, optional
 637                List of node names to train. If None, all nodes are trained.
 638            train_mode : {"sequential", "parallel"}, default "sequential"
 639                Training mode. "parallel" uses joblib-based CPU multiprocessing.
 640                GPU forces sequential mode.
 641            device : {"auto", "cpu", "cuda"}, default "auto"
 642                Device selection.
 643            optimizers : dict or None
 644                Optional mapping ``{node_name: optimizer}``. If provided for a
 645                node, that optimizer is used instead of creating a new Adam.
 646            schedulers : dict or None
 647                Optional mapping ``{node_name: scheduler}``.
 648            use_scheduler : bool
 649                If True, enable scheduler usage in the training loop.
 650            num_workers : int
 651                DataLoader workers in sequential mode (ignored in parallel).
 652            persistent_workers : bool
 653                DataLoader persistence in sequential mode (ignored in parallel).
 654            prefetch_factor : int
 655                DataLoader prefetch factor (ignored in parallel).
 656            batch_size : int
 657                Batch size for all node DataLoaders.
 658            debug : bool
 659                Enable debug output.
 660            verbose : bool
 661                Enable informational logging.
 662            return_history : bool
 663                If True, return a history dict.
 664
 665        Returns
 666        -------
 667        dict or None
 668            If ``return_history=True``, a dictionary mapping each node name
 669            to its training history. Otherwise, returns None.
 670
 671        Raises
 672        ------
 673        ValueError
 674            If ``train_mode`` is not "sequential" or "parallel".
 675        """
 676        self._validate_kwargs(kwargs, defaults_attr='DEFAULTS_FIT', context="fit")
 677        
 678        # --- merge defaults ---
 679        settings = dict(self.DEFAULTS_FIT)
 680        settings.update(kwargs)
 681        
 682        
 683        self.debug = settings.get("debug", False)
 684        self.verbose = settings.get("verbose", False)
 685
 686        # --- resolve device ---
 687        device_str=self.get_device(settings)
 688        self.device = torch.device(device_str)
 689
 690        # --- training mode ---
 691        train_mode = settings.get("train_mode", "sequential").lower()
 692        if train_mode not in ("sequential", "parallel"):
 693            raise ValueError("train_mode must be 'sequential' or 'parallel'")
 694
 695        # --- DataLoader safety logic ---
 696        if train_mode == "parallel":
 697            # if user passed loader paralleling params, warn and override
 698            for flag in ("num_workers", "persistent_workers", "prefetch_factor"):
 699                if flag in kwargs:
 700                    print(f"[WARNING] '{flag}' is ignored in parallel mode "
 701                        f"(disabled to prevent nested multiprocessing).")
 702            # disable unsafe loader multiprocessing options
 703            settings["num_workers"] = 0
 704            settings["persistent_workers"] = False
 705            settings["prefetch_factor"] = None
 706        else:
 707            # sequential mode â†’ respect user DataLoader settings
 708            if self.debug:
 709                print("[DEBUG] Sequential mode: using DataLoader kwargs as provided.")
 710
 711        # --- which nodes to train ---
 712        train_list = settings.get("train_list") or list(self.models.keys())
 713
 714
 715        # --- dataset prep (receives adjusted settings) ---
 716        td_train_data = self._ensure_dataset(train_data, is_val=False, **settings)
 717        td_val_data = self._ensure_dataset(val_data, is_val=True, **settings)
 718
 719        # --- normalization ---
 720        self.load_or_compute_minmax(use_existing=False, write=True, td_train_data=td_train_data)
 721
 722        # --- print header ---
 723        if self.verbose or self.debug:
 724            print(f"[INFO] Training {len(train_list)} nodes ({train_mode}) on {device_str}")
 725
 726        # ======================================================================
 727        # Sequential mode  safe for GPU or debugging)
 728        # ======================================================================
 729        if train_mode == "sequential" or "cuda" in device_str:
 730            if "cuda" in device_str and train_mode == "parallel":
 731                print("[WARNING] GPU device detected â€” forcing sequential mode.")
 732            results = {}
 733            for node in train_list:
 734                node, history = self._fit_single_node(
 735                    node, self, settings, td_train_data, td_val_data, device_str
 736                )
 737                results[node] = history
 738        
 739
 740        # ======================================================================
 741        # parallel mode (CPU only)
 742        # ======================================================================
 743        if train_mode == "parallel":
 744
 745            n_jobs = min(len(train_list), os.cpu_count() // 2 or 1)
 746            if self.verbose or self.debug:
 747                print(f"[INFO] Using {n_jobs} CPU workers for parallel node training")
 748            parallel_outputs = Parallel(
 749                n_jobs=n_jobs,
 750                backend="loky",#loky, multiprocessing
 751                verbose=10,
 752                prefer="processes"
 753            )(delayed(self._fit_single_node)(node, self, settings, td_train_data, td_val_data, device_str) for node in train_list )
 754
 755            results = {node: hist for node, hist in parallel_outputs}
 756        
 757        if settings.get("return_history", False):
 758            return results
 759
 760    ## FIT-DIAGNOSTICS
 761    def loss_history(self):
 762        """
 763        Load training and validation loss history for all nodes.
 764
 765        Looks for per-node JSON files:
 766
 767        - ``EXPERIMENT_DIR/{node}/train_loss_hist.json``
 768        - ``EXPERIMENT_DIR/{node}/val_loss_hist.json``
 769
 770        Returns
 771        -------
 772        dict
 773            A dictionary mapping node names to:
 774
 775            .. code-block:: python
 776
 777                {
 778                    "train": list or None,
 779                    "validation": list or None
 780                }
 781
 782            where each list contains NLL values per epoch, or None if not found.
 783
 784        Raises
 785        ------
 786        ValueError
 787            If the experiment directory cannot be resolved from the configuration.
 788        """
 789        try:
 790            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 791        except KeyError:
 792            raise ValueError(
 793                "[ERROR] Missing 'EXPERIMENT_DIR' in cfg.conf_dict['PATHS']. "
 794                "History retrieval requires experiment logs."
 795            )
 796
 797        all_histories = {}
 798        for node in self.nodes_dict.keys():
 799            node_dir = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, node)
 800            train_path = os.path.join(node_dir, "train_loss_hist.json")
 801            val_path = os.path.join(node_dir, "val_loss_hist.json")
 802
 803            node_hist = {}
 804
 805            # --- load train history ---
 806            if os.path.exists(train_path):
 807                try:
 808                    with open(train_path, "r") as f:
 809                        node_hist["train"] = json.load(f)
 810                except Exception as e:
 811                    print(f"[WARNING] Could not load {train_path}: {e}")
 812                    node_hist["train"] = None
 813            else:
 814                node_hist["train"] = None
 815
 816            # --- load val history ---
 817            if os.path.exists(val_path):
 818                try:
 819                    with open(val_path, "r") as f:
 820                        node_hist["validation"] = json.load(f)
 821                except Exception as e:
 822                    print(f"[WARNING] Could not load {val_path}: {e}")
 823                    node_hist["validation"] = None
 824            else:
 825                node_hist["validation"] = None
 826
 827            all_histories[node] = node_hist
 828
 829        if self.verbose or self.debug:
 830            print(f"[INFO] Loaded training/validation histories for {len(all_histories)} nodes.")
 831
 832        return all_histories
 833
 834    def linear_shift_history(self):
 835        """
 836        Load linear shift term histories for all nodes.
 837
 838        Each node history is expected in a JSON file named
 839        ``linear_shifts_all_epochs.json`` under the node directory.
 840
 841        Returns
 842        -------
 843        dict
 844            A mapping ``{node_name: pandas.DataFrame}``, where each DataFrame
 845            contains linear shift weights across epochs.
 846
 847        Raises
 848        ------
 849        ValueError
 850            If the experiment directory cannot be resolved from the configuration.
 851
 852        Notes
 853        -----
 854        If a history file is missing for a node, a warning is printed and the
 855        node is omitted from the returned dictionary.
 856        """
 857        histories = {}
 858        try:
 859            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 860        except KeyError:
 861            raise ValueError(
 862                "[ERROR] Missing 'EXPERIMENT_DIR' in cfg.conf_dict['PATHS']. "
 863                "Cannot load histories without experiment directory."
 864            )
 865
 866        for node in self.nodes_dict.keys():
 867            node_dir = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, node)
 868            history_path = os.path.join(node_dir, "linear_shifts_all_epochs.json")
 869            if os.path.exists(history_path):
 870                histories[node] = pd.read_json(history_path)
 871            else:
 872                print(f"[WARNING] No linear shift history found for node '{node}' at {history_path}")
 873        return histories

 891            If the experiment directory cannot be resolved from the configuration.

 893        Notes

 895        If a history file is missing for a node, a warning is printed and the
 896        node is omitted from the returned dictionary.

 898        histories = {}
 899        try:
 900            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 901        except KeyError:
 902            raise ValueError(
 903                "[ERROR] Missing 'EXPERIMENT_DIR' in cfg.conf_dict['PATHS']. "
 904                "Cannot load histories without experiment directory."
 905            )
 906
 907        for node in self.nodes_dict.keys():
 908            node_dir = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, node)
 909            history_path = os.path.join(node_dir, "simple_intercepts_all_epochs.json")

 916    def get_latent(self, df, verbose=False):
 917        """
 918        Compute latent representations for all nodes in the DAG.
 919
 920        Parameters
 921        ----------
 922        df : pandas.DataFrame
 923            Input data frame with columns corresponding to nodes in the DAG.
 924        verbose : bool, optional
 925            If True, print informational messages during latent computation.
 926            Default is False.
 927
 928        Returns
 929        -------
 930        pandas.DataFrame
 931            DataFrame containing the original columns plus latent variables
 932            for each node (e.g. columns named ``f"{node}_U"``).
 933
 934        Raises
 935        ------
 936        ValueError
 937            If the experiment directory is missing from the configuration or
 938            if ``self.minmax_dict`` has not been set.
 939        """
 940        try:
 941            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 942        except KeyError:
 943            raise ValueError(
 944                "[ERROR] Missing 'EXPERIMENT_DIR' in cfg.conf_dict['PATHS']. "
 945                "Latent extraction requires trained model checkpoints."
 946            )
 947
 948        # ensure minmax_dict is available
 949        if not hasattr(self, "minmax_dict"):
 950            raise ValueError(
 951                "[ERROR] minmax_dict not found in the TramDagModel instance. "
 952                "Either call .load_or_compute_minmax(td_train_data=train_df) or .fit() first."
 953            )
 954
 955        all_latents_df = create_latent_df_for_full_dag(
 956            configuration_dict=self.cfg.conf_dict,
 957            EXPERIMENT_DIR=EXPERIMENT_DIR,
 958            df=df,
 959            verbose=verbose,
 960            min_max_dict=self.minmax_dict,
 961        )
 962
 963        return all_latents_df
