 966    ## PLOTTING FIT-DIAGNOSTICS
 967    
 968    def plot_loss_history(self, variable: str = None):
 969        """
 970        Plot training and validation loss evolution per node.
 971
 972        Parameters
 973        ----------
 974        variable : str or None, optional
 975            If provided, plot loss history for this node only. If None, plot
 976            histories for all nodes that have both train and validation logs.
 977
 978        Returns
 979        -------
 980        None
 981
 982        Notes
 983        -----
 984        Two subplots are produced:
 985        - Full epoch history.
 986        - Last 10% of epochs (or only the last epoch if fewer than 5 epochs).
 987        """
 988
 989        histories = self.loss_history()
 990        if not histories:
 991            print("[WARNING] No loss histories found.")
 992            return
 993
 994        # Select which nodes to plot
 995        if variable is not None:
 996            if variable not in histories:
 997                raise ValueError(f"[ERROR] Node '{variable}' not found in histories.")
 998            nodes_to_plot = [variable]
 999        else:
1000            nodes_to_plot = list(histories.keys())
1001
1002        # Filter out nodes with no valid history
1003        nodes_to_plot = [
1004            n for n in nodes_to_plot
1005            if histories[n].get("train") is not None and len(histories[n]["train"]) > 0
1006            and histories[n].get("validation") is not None and len(histories[n]["validation"]) > 0
1007        ]
1008
1009        if not nodes_to_plot:
1010            print("[WARNING] No valid histories found to plot.")
1011            return
1012
1013        plt.figure(figsize=(14, 12))
1014
1015        # --- Full history (top plot) ---
1016        plt.subplot(2, 1, 1)
1017        for node in nodes_to_plot:
1018            node_hist = histories[node]
1019            train_hist, val_hist = node_hist["train"], node_hist["validation"]
1020
1021            epochs = range(1, len(train_hist) + 1)
1022            plt.plot(epochs, train_hist, label=f"{node} - train", linestyle="--")
1023            plt.plot(epochs, val_hist, label=f"{node} - val")
1024
1025        plt.title("Training and Validation NLL - Full History")
1026        plt.xlabel("Epoch")
1027        plt.ylabel("NLL")
1028        plt.legend()
1029        plt.grid(True)
1030
1031        # --- Last 10% of epochs (bottom plot) ---
1032        plt.subplot(2, 1, 2)
1033        for node in nodes_to_plot:
1034            node_hist = histories[node]
1035            train_hist, val_hist = node_hist["train"], node_hist["validation"]
1036
1037            total_epochs = len(train_hist)
1038            start_idx = total_epochs - 1 if total_epochs < 5 else int(total_epochs * 0.9)
1039
1040            epochs = range(start_idx + 1, total_epochs + 1)
1041            plt.plot(epochs, train_hist[start_idx:], label=f"{node} - train", linestyle="--")
1042            plt.plot(epochs, val_hist[start_idx:], label=f"{node} - val")
1043
1044        plt.title("Training and Validation NLL - Last 10% of Epochs (or Last Epoch if <5)")
1045        plt.xlabel("Epoch")
1046        plt.ylabel("NLL")
1047        plt.legend()
1048        plt.grid(True)
1049
1050        plt.tight_layout()
1051        plt.show()
1052
1053    def plot_linear_shift_history(self, data_dict=None, node=None, ref_lines=None):
1054        """
1055        Plot the evolution of linear shift terms over epochs.
1056
1057        Parameters
1058        ----------
1059        data_dict : dict or None, optional
1060            Pre-loaded mapping ``{node_name: pandas.DataFrame}`` containing shift
1061            weights across epochs. If None, `linear_shift_history()` is called.
1062        node : str or None, optional
1063            If provided, plot only this node. Otherwise, plot all nodes
1064            present in ``data_dict``.
1065        ref_lines : dict or None, optional
1066            Optional mapping ``{node_name: list of float}``. For each specified
1067            node, horizontal reference lines are drawn at the given values.
1068
1069        Returns
1070        -------
1071        None
1072
1073        Notes
1074        -----
1075        The function flattens nested list-like entries in the DataFrames to scalars,
1076        converts epoch labels to numeric, and then draws one line per shift term.
1077        """
1078
1079        if data_dict is None:
1080            data_dict = self.linear_shift_history()
1081            if data_dict is None:
1082                raise ValueError("No shift history data provided or stored in the class.")
1083
1084        nodes = [node] if node else list(data_dict.keys())
1085
1086        for n in nodes:
1087            df = data_dict[n].copy()
1088
1089            # Flatten nested lists or list-like cells
1090            def flatten(x):
1091                if isinstance(x, list):
1092                    if len(x) == 0:
1093                        return np.nan
1094                    if all(isinstance(i, (int, float)) for i in x):
1095                        return np.mean(x)  # average simple list
1096                    if all(isinstance(i, list) for i in x):
1097                        # nested list -> flatten inner and average
1098                        flat = [v for sub in x for v in (sub if isinstance(sub, list) else [sub])]
1099                        return np.mean(flat) if flat else np.nan
1100                    return x[0] if len(x) == 1 else np.nan
1101                return x
1102
1103            df = df.applymap(flatten)
1104
1105            # Ensure numeric columns
1106            df = df.apply(pd.to_numeric, errors='coerce')
1107
1108            # Convert epoch labels to numeric
1109            df.columns = [
1110                int(c.replace("epoch_", "")) if isinstance(c, str) and c.startswith("epoch_") else c
1111                for c in df.columns
1112            ]
1113            df = df.reindex(sorted(df.columns), axis=1)
1114
1115            plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
1116            for idx in df.index:
1117                plt.plot(df.columns, df.loc[idx], lw=1.4, label=f"shift_{idx}")
1118
1119            if ref_lines and n in ref_lines:
1120                for v in ref_lines[n]:
1121                    plt.axhline(y=v, color="k", linestyle="--", lw=1.0)
1122                    plt.text(df.columns[-1], v, f"{n}: {v}", va="bottom", ha="right", fontsize=8)
1123
1124            plt.xlabel("Epoch")
1125            plt.ylabel("Shift Value")
1126            plt.title(f"Shift Term History â€” Node: {n}")
1127            plt.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc="upper left", fontsize="small")
1128            plt.tight_layout()
1129            plt.show()
1130
1131    def plot_simple_intercepts_history(self, data_dict=None, node=None,ref_lines=None):
1132        """
1133        Plot the evolution of simple intercept weights over epochs.
1134
1135        Parameters
1136        ----------
1137        data_dict : dict or None, optional
1138            Pre-loaded mapping ``{node_name: pandas.DataFrame}`` containing intercept
1139            weights across epochs. If None, `simple_intercept_history()` is called.
1140        node : str or None, optional
1141            If provided, plot only this node. Otherwise, plot all nodes present
1142            in ``data_dict``.
1143        ref_lines : dict or None, optional
1144            Optional mapping ``{node_name: list of float}``. For each specified
1145            node, horizontal reference lines are drawn at the given values.
1146
1147        Returns
1148        -------
1149        None
1150
1151        Notes
1152        -----
1153        Nested list-like entries in the DataFrames are reduced to scalars before
1154        plotting. One line is drawn per intercept parameter.
1155        """
1156        if data_dict is None:
1157            data_dict = self.simple_intercept_history()
1158            if data_dict is None:
1159                raise ValueError("No intercept history data provided or stored in the class.")
1160
1161        nodes = [node] if node else list(data_dict.keys())
1162
1163        for n in nodes:
1164            df = data_dict[n].copy()
1165
1166            def extract_scalar(x):
1167                if isinstance(x, list):
1168                    while isinstance(x, list) and len(x) > 0:
1169                        x = x[0]
1170                return float(x) if isinstance(x, (int, float, np.floating)) else np.nan
1171
1172            df = df.applymap(extract_scalar)
1173
1174            # Convert epoch labels â†’ numeric
1175            df.columns = [
1176                int(c.replace("epoch_", "")) if isinstance(c, str) and c.startswith("epoch_") else c
1177                for c in df.columns
1178            ]
1179            df = df.reindex(sorted(df.columns), axis=1)
1180
1181            plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
1182            for idx in df.index:
1183                plt.plot(df.columns, df.loc[idx], lw=1.4, label=f"theta_{idx}")
1184            
1185            if ref_lines and n in ref_lines:
1186                for v in ref_lines[n]:
1187                    plt.axhline(y=v, color="k", linestyle="--", lw=1.0)
1188                    plt.text(df.columns[-1], v, f"{n}: {v}", va="bottom", ha="right", fontsize=8)
1189                
1190            plt.xlabel("Epoch")
1191            plt.ylabel("Intercept Weight")
1192            plt.title(f"Simple Intercept Evolution â€” Node: {n}")
1193            plt.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc="upper left", fontsize="small")
1194            plt.tight_layout()
1195            plt.show()
1196
1197    def plot_latents(self, df, variable: str = None, confidence: float = 0.95, simulations: int = 1000):
1198        """
1199        Visualize latent U distributions for one or all nodes.
1200
1201        Parameters
1202        ----------
1203        df : pandas.DataFrame
1204            Input data frame with raw node values.
1205        variable : str or None, optional
1206            If provided, only this node's latents are plotted. If None, all
1207            nodes with latent columns are processed.
1208        confidence : float, optional
1209            Confidence level for QQ-plot bands (0 < confidence < 1).
1210            Default is 0.95.
1211        simulations : int, optional
1212            Number of Monte Carlo simulations for QQ-plot bands. Default is 1000.
1213
1214        Returns
1215        -------
1216        None
1217
1218        Notes
1219        -----
1220        For each node, two plots are produced:
1221        - Histogram of the latent U values.
1222        - QQ-plot with simulation-based confidence bands under a logistic reference.
1223        """
1224        # Compute latent representations
1225        latents_df = self.get_latent(df)
1226
1227        # Select nodes
1228        nodes = [variable] if variable is not None else self.nodes_dict.keys()
1229
1230        for node in nodes:
1231            if f"{node}_U" not in latents_df.columns:
1232                print(f"[WARNING] No latent found for node {node}, skipping.")
1233                continue
1234
1235            sample = latents_df[f"{node}_U"].values
1236
1237            # --- Create plots ---
1238            fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(12, 5))
1239
1240            # Histogram
1241            axs[0].hist(sample, bins=50, color="steelblue", alpha=0.7)
1242            axs[0].set_title(f"Latent Histogram ({node})")
1243            axs[0].set_xlabel("U")
1244            axs[0].set_ylabel("Frequency")
1245
1246            # QQ Plot with confidence bands
1247            probplot(sample, dist="logistic", plot=axs[1])
1248            self._add_r_style_confidence_bands(axs[1], sample, dist=logistic,confidence=confidence, simulations=simulations)
1249            axs[1].set_title(f"Latent QQ Plot ({node})")
1250
1251            plt.suptitle(f"Latent Diagnostics for Node: {node}", fontsize=14)
1252            plt.tight_layout(rect=[0, 0.03, 1, 0.95])
1253            plt.show()
1254
1255    def plot_hdag(self,df,variables=None, plot_n_rows=1,**kwargs):
1256        
1257        """
1258        Visualize the transformation function h() for selected DAG nodes.
1259
1260        Parameters
1261        ----------
1262        df : pandas.DataFrame
1263            Input data containing node values or model predictions.
1264        variables : list of str or None, optional
1265            Names of nodes to visualize. If None, all nodes in ``self.models``
1266            are considered.
1267        plot_n_rows : int, optional
1268            Maximum number of rows from ``df`` to visualize. Default is 1.
1269        **kwargs
1270            Additional keyword arguments forwarded to the underlying plotting
1271            helpers (`show_hdag_continous` / `show_hdag_ordinal`).
1272
1273        Returns
1274        -------
1275        None
1276
1277        Notes
1278        -----
1279        - For continuous outcomes, `show_hdag_continous` is called.
1280        - For ordinal outcomes, `show_hdag_ordinal` is called.
1281        - Nodes that are neither continuous nor ordinal are skipped with a warning.
1282        """
1283                
1284
1285        if len(df)> 1:
1286            print("[WARNING] len(df)>1, set: plot_n_rows accordingly")
1287        
1288        variables_list=variables if variables is not None else list(self.models.keys())
1289        for node in variables_list:
1290            if is_outcome_modelled_continous(node, self.nodes_dict):
1291                show_hdag_continous(df,node=node,configuration_dict=self.cfg.conf_dict,minmax_dict=self.minmax_dict,device=self.device,plot_n_rows=plot_n_rows,**kwargs)
1292            
1293            elif is_outcome_modelled_ordinal(node, self.nodes_dict):
1294                show_hdag_ordinal(df,node=node,configuration_dict=self.cfg.conf_dict,device=self.device,plot_n_rows=plot_n_rows,**kwargs)
1295                # plot_cutpoints_with_logistic(df,node=node,configuration_dict=self.cfg.conf_dict,device=self.device,plot_n_rows=plot_n_rows,**kwargs)
1296                # save_cutpoints_with_logistic(df,node=node,configuration_dict=self.cfg.conf_dict,device=self.device,**kwargs)
1297            else:
1298                print(f"[WARNING] Node {node} is wheter ordinal nor continous, not implemented yet")
1299    
1300    @staticmethod
1301    def _add_r_style_confidence_bands(ax, sample, dist, confidence=0.95, simulations=1000):
1302        """
1303        Add simulation-based confidence bands to a QQ-plot.
1304
1305        Parameters
1306        ----------
1307        ax : matplotlib.axes.Axes
1308            Axes object on which to draw the QQ-plot and bands.
1309        sample : array-like
1310            Empirical sample used in the QQ-plot.
1311        dist : scipy.stats distribution
1312            Distribution object providing ``ppf`` and ``rvs`` methods (e.g. logistic).
1313        confidence : float, optional
1314            Confidence level (0 < confidence < 1) for the bands. Default is 0.95.
1315        simulations : int, optional
1316            Number of Monte Carlo simulations used to estimate the bands. Default is 1000.
1317
1318        Returns
1319        -------
1320        None
1321
1322        Notes
1323        -----
1324        The axes are cleared, and a new QQ-plot is drawn with:
1325        - Empirical vs. theoretical quantiles.
1326        - 45-degree reference line.
1327        - Shaded confidence band region.
1328        """
1329        
1330        n = len(sample)
1331        if n == 0:
1332            return
1333
1334        quantiles = np.linspace(0, 1, n, endpoint=False) + 0.5 / n
1335        theo_q = dist.ppf(quantiles)
1336
1337        # Simulate order statistics from the theoretical distribution
1338        sim_data = dist.rvs(size=(simulations, n))
1339        sim_order_stats = np.sort(sim_data, axis=1)
1340
1341        # Confidence bands
1342        lower = np.percentile(sim_order_stats, 100 * (1 - confidence) / 2, axis=0)
1343        upper = np.percentile(sim_order_stats, 100 * (1 + confidence) / 2, axis=0)
1344
1345        # Sort empirical sample
1346        sample_sorted = np.sort(sample)
1347
1348        # Re-draw points and CI (overwrite probplot defaults)
1349        ax.clear()
1350        ax.plot(theo_q, sample_sorted, 'o', markersize=3, alpha=0.6, label="Empirical Q-Q")
1351        ax.plot(theo_q, theo_q, 'b--', label="y = x")
1352        ax.fill_between(theo_q, lower, upper, color='gray', alpha=0.3,
1353                        label=f'{int(confidence*100)}% CI')
1354        ax.legend()
1355    
1356    ## SAMPLING METHODS
1357    def sample(
1358        self,
1359        do_interventions: dict = None,
1360        predefined_latent_samples_df: pd.DataFrame = None,
1361        **kwargs,
1362    ):
1363        """
1364        Sample from the joint DAG using the trained TRAM models.
1365
1366        Allows for:
1367        
1368        Oberservational sampling
1369        Interventional sampling via ``do()`` operations
1370        Counterfactial sampling using predefined latent draws and do()
1371        
1372        Parameters
1373        ----------
1374        do_interventions : dict or None, optional
1375            Mapping of node names to intervened (fixed) values. For example:
1376            ``{"x1": 1.0}`` represents ``do(x1 = 1.0)``. Default is None.
1377        predefined_latent_samples_df : pandas.DataFrame or None, optional
1378            DataFrame containing columns ``"{node}_U"`` with predefined latent
1379            draws to be used instead of sampling from the prior. Default is None.
1380        **kwargs
1381            Sampling options overriding internal defaults:
1382
1383            number_of_samples : int, default 10000
1384                Total number of samples to draw.
1385            batch_size : int, default 32
1386                Batch size for internal sampling loops.
1387            delete_all_previously_sampled : bool, default True
1388                If True, delete old sampling files in node-specific sampling
1389                directories before writing new ones.
1390            verbose : bool
1391                If True, print informational messages.
1392            debug : bool
1393                If True, print debug output.
1394            device : {"auto", "cpu", "cuda"}
1395                Device selection for sampling.
1396            use_initial_weights_for_sampling : bool, default False
1397                If True, sample from initial (untrained) model parameters.
1398
1399        Returns
1400        -------
1401        tuple
1402            A tuple ``(sampled_by_node, latents_by_node)``:
1403
1404            sampled_by_node : dict
1405                Mapping ``{node_name: torch.Tensor}`` of sampled node values.
1406            latents_by_node : dict
1407                Mapping ``{node_name: torch.Tensor}`` of latent U values used.
1408
1409        Raises
1410        ------
1411        ValueError
1412            If the experiment directory cannot be resolved or if scaling
1413            information (``self.minmax_dict``) is missing.
1414        RuntimeError
1415            If minâ€“max scaling has not been computed before calling `sample`.
1416        """
1417        try:
1418            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
1419        except KeyError:
1420            raise ValueError(
1421                "[ERROR] Missing 'EXPERIMENT_DIR' in cfg.conf_dict['PATHS']. "
1422                "Sampling requires trained model checkpoints."
1423            )
1424
1425        # ---- defaults ----
1426        settings = {
1427            "number_of_samples": 10_000,
1428            "batch_size": 32,
1429            "delete_all_previously_sampled": True,
1430            "verbose": self.verbose if hasattr(self, "verbose") else False,
1431            "debug": self.debug if hasattr(self, "debug") else False,
1432            "device": self.device.type if hasattr(self, "device") else "auto",
1433            "use_initial_weights_for_sampling": False,
1434            
1435        }
1436        
1437        # TODO adjust validation
1438        # self._validate_kwargs( kwargs, defaults_attr= "settings", context="sample")
1439        
1440        settings.update(kwargs)
1441
1442        
1443        if not hasattr(self, "minmax_dict"):
1444            raise RuntimeError(
1445                "[ERROR] minmax_dict not found. You must call .fit() or .load_or_compute_minmax() "
1446                "before sampling, so scaling info is available."
1447                )
1448            
1449        # ---- resolve device ----
1450        device_str=self.get_device(settings)
1451        self.device = torch.device(device_str)
1452
1453
1454        if self.debug or settings["debug"]:
1455            print(f"[DEBUG] sample(): device: {self.device}")
1456
1457        # ---- perform sampling ----
1458        sampled_by_node, latents_by_node = sample_full_dag(
1459            configuration_dict=self.cfg.conf_dict,
1460            EXPERIMENT_DIR=EXPERIMENT_DIR,
1461            device=self.device,
1462            do_interventions=do_interventions or {},
1463            predefined_latent_samples_df=predefined_latent_samples_df,
1464            number_of_samples=settings["number_of_samples"],
1465            batch_size=settings["batch_size"],
1466            delete_all_previously_sampled=settings["delete_all_previously_sampled"],
1467            verbose=settings["verbose"],
1468            debug=settings["debug"],
1469            minmax_dict=self.minmax_dict,
1470            use_initial_weights_for_sampling=settings["use_initial_weights_for_sampling"]
1471        )
1472
1473        return sampled_by_node, latents_by_node
1474
1475    def load_sampled_and_latents(self, EXPERIMENT_DIR: str = None, nodes: list = None):
1476        """
1477        Load previously stored sampled values and latents for each node.
1478
1479        Parameters
1480        ----------
1481        EXPERIMENT_DIR : str or None, optional
1482            Experiment directory path. If None, it is taken from
1483            ``self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]``.
1484        nodes : list of str or None, optional
1485            Nodes for which to load samples. If None, use all nodes from
1486            ``self.nodes_dict``.
1487
1488        Returns
1489        -------
1490        tuple
1491            A tuple ``(sampled_by_node, latents_by_node)``:
1492
1493            sampled_by_node : dict
1494                Mapping ``{node_name: torch.Tensor}`` of sampled values (on CPU).
1495            latents_by_node : dict
1496                Mapping ``{node_name: torch.Tensor}`` of latent values (on CPU).
1497
1498        Raises
1499        ------
1500        ValueError
1501            If the experiment directory cannot be resolved or if no node list
1502            is available and ``nodes`` is None.
1503
1504        Notes
1505        -----
1506        Nodes without both ``sampled.pt`` and ``latents.pt`` files are skipped
1507        with a warning.
1508        """
1509        # --- resolve paths and node list ---
1510        if EXPERIMENT_DIR is None:
1511            try:
1512                EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
1513            except (AttributeError, KeyError):
1514                raise ValueError(
1515                    "[ERROR] Could not resolve EXPERIMENT_DIR from cfg.conf_dict['PATHS']. "
1516                    "Please provide EXPERIMENT_DIR explicitly."
1517                )
1518
1519        if nodes is None:
1520            if hasattr(self, "nodes_dict"):
1521                nodes = list(self.nodes_dict.keys())
1522            else:
1523                raise ValueError(
1524                    "[ERROR] No node list found. Please provide `nodes` or initialize model with a config."
1525                )
1526
1527        # --- load tensors ---
1528        sampled_by_node = {}
1529        latents_by_node = {}
1530
1531        for node in nodes:
1532            node_dir = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, f"{node}")
1533            sampling_dir = os.path.join(node_dir, "sampling")
1534
1535            sampled_path = os.path.join(sampling_dir, "sampled.pt")
1536            latents_path = os.path.join(sampling_dir, "latents.pt")
1537
1538            if not os.path.exists(sampled_path) or not os.path.exists(latents_path):
1539                print(f"[WARNING] Missing files for node '{node}' â€” skipping.")
1540                continue
1541
1542            try:
1543                sampled = torch.load(sampled_path, map_location="cpu")
1544                latent_sample = torch.load(latents_path, map_location="cpu")
1545            except Exception as e:
1546                print(f"[ERROR] Could not load sampling files for node '{node}': {e}")
1547                continue
1548
1549            sampled_by_node[node] = sampled.detach().cpu()
1550            latents_by_node[node] = latent_sample.detach().cpu()
1551
1552        if self.verbose or self.debug:
1553            print(f"[INFO] Loaded sampled and latent tensors for {len(sampled_by_node)} nodes from {EXPERIMENT_DIR}")
1554
1555        return sampled_by_node, latents_by_node
1556
1557    def plot_samples_vs_true(
1558        self,
1559        df,
1560        sampled: dict = None,
1561        variable: list = None,
1562        bins: int = 100,
1563        hist_true_color: str = "blue",
1564        hist_est_color: str = "orange",
1565        figsize: tuple = (14, 5),
1566    ):
1567        
1568        
1569        """
1570        Compare sampled vs. observed distributions for selected nodes.
1571
1572        Parameters
1573        ----------
1574        df : pandas.DataFrame
1575            Data frame containing the observed node values.
1576        sampled : dict or None, optional
1577            Optional mapping ``{node_name: array-like or torch.Tensor}`` of sampled
1578            values. If None or if a node is missing, samples are loaded from
1579            ``EXPERIMENT_DIR/{node}/sampling/sampled.pt``.
1580        variable : list of str or None, optional
1581            Subset of nodes to plot. If None, all nodes in the configuration
1582            are considered.
1583        bins : int, optional
1584            Number of histogram bins for continuous variables. Default is 100.
1585        hist_true_color : str, optional
1586            Color name for the histogram of true values. Default is "blue".
1587        hist_est_color : str, optional
1588            Color name for the histogram of sampled values. Default is "orange".
1589        figsize : tuple, optional
1590            Figure size for the matplotlib plots. Default is (14, 5).
1591
1592        Returns
1593        -------
1594        None
1595
1596        Notes
1597        -----
1598        - Continuous outcomes: histogram overlay + QQ-plot.
1599        - Ordinal outcomes: side-by-side bar plot of relative frequencies.
1600        - Other categorical outcomes: side-by-side bar plot with category labels.
1601        - If samples are probabilistic (2D tensor), the argmax across classes is used.
1602        """
1603        
1604        target_nodes = self.cfg.conf_dict["nodes"]
1605        experiment_dir = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
1606        device = torch.device("cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")
1607
1608        plot_list = variable if variable is not None else target_nodes
1609
1610        for node in plot_list:
1611            # Load sampled data
1612            if sampled is not None and node in sampled:
1613                sdata = sampled[node]
1614                if isinstance(sdata, torch.Tensor):
1615                    sampled_vals = sdata.detach().cpu().numpy()
1616                else:
1617                    sampled_vals = np.asarray(sdata)
1618            else:
1619                sample_path = os.path.join(experiment_dir, f"{node}/sampling/sampled.pt")
1620                if not os.path.isfile(sample_path):
1621                    print(f"[WARNING] skip {node}: {sample_path} not found.")
1622                    continue
1623
1624                try:
1625                    sampled_vals = torch.load(sample_path, map_location=device).cpu().numpy()
1626                except Exception as e:
1627                    print(f"[ERROR] Could not load {sample_path}: {e}")
1628                    continue
1629
1630            # If logits/probabilities per sample, take argmax
1631            if sampled_vals.ndim == 2:
1632                    print(f"[INFO] CAUTION! {node}: samples are probabilistic â€” each sample follows a probability "
1633                    f"distribution based on the valid latent range. "
1634                    f"Note that this frequency plot reflects only the distribution of the most probable "
1635                    f"class per sample.")
1636                    sampled_vals = np.argmax(sampled_vals, axis=1)
1637
1638            sampled_vals = sampled_vals[np.isfinite(sampled_vals)]
1639
1640            if node not in df.columns:
1641                print(f"[WARNING] skip {node}: column not found in DataFrame.")
1642                continue
1643
1644            true_vals = df[node].dropna().values
1645            true_vals = true_vals[np.isfinite(true_vals)]
1646
1647            if sampled_vals.size == 0 or true_vals.size == 0:
1648                print(f"[WARNING] skip {node}: empty array after NaN/Inf removal.")
1649                continue
1650
1651            fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=figsize)
1652
1653            if is_outcome_modelled_continous(node, target_nodes):
1654                axs[0].hist(true_vals, bins=bins, density=True, alpha=0.6,
1655                            color=hist_true_color, label=f"True {node}")
1656                axs[0].hist(sampled_vals, bins=bins, density=True, alpha=0.6,
1657                            color=hist_est_color, label="Sampled")
1658                axs[0].set_xlabel("Value")
1659                axs[0].set_ylabel("Density")
1660                axs[0].set_title(f"Histogram overlay for {node}")
1661                axs[0].legend()
1662                axs[0].grid(True, ls="--", alpha=0.4)
1663
1664                qqplot_2samples(true_vals, sampled_vals, line="45", ax=axs[1])
1665                axs[1].set_xlabel("True quantiles")
1666                axs[1].set_ylabel("Sampled quantiles")
1667                axs[1].set_title(f"QQ plot for {node}")
1668                axs[1].grid(True, ls="--", alpha=0.4)
1669
1670            elif is_outcome_modelled_ordinal(node, target_nodes):
1671                unique_vals = np.union1d(np.unique(true_vals), np.unique(sampled_vals))
1672                unique_vals = np.sort(unique_vals)
1673                true_counts = np.array([(true_vals == val).sum() for val in unique_vals])
1674                sampled_counts = np.array([(sampled_vals == val).sum() for val in unique_vals])
1675
1676                axs[0].bar(unique_vals - 0.2, true_counts / true_counts.sum(),
1677                        width=0.4, color=hist_true_color, alpha=0.7, label="True")
1678                axs[0].bar(unique_vals + 0.2, sampled_counts / sampled_counts.sum(),
1679                        width=0.4, color=hist_est_color, alpha=0.7, label="Sampled")
1680                axs[0].set_xticks(unique_vals)
1681                axs[0].set_xlabel("Ordinal Level")
1682                axs[0].set_ylabel("Relative Frequency")
1683                axs[0].set_title(f"Ordinal bar plot for {node}")
1684                axs[0].legend()
1685                axs[0].grid(True, ls="--", alpha=0.4)
1686                axs[1].axis("off")
1687
1688            else:
1689                unique_vals = np.union1d(np.unique(true_vals), np.unique(sampled_vals))
1690                unique_vals = sorted(unique_vals, key=str)
1691                true_counts = np.array([(true_vals == val).sum() for val in unique_vals])
1692                sampled_counts = np.array([(sampled_vals == val).sum() for val in unique_vals])
1693
1694                axs[0].bar(np.arange(len(unique_vals)) - 0.2, true_counts / true_counts.sum(),
1695                        width=0.4, color=hist_true_color, alpha=0.7, label="True")
1696                axs[0].bar(np.arange(len(unique_vals)) + 0.2, sampled_counts / sampled_counts.sum(),
1697                        width=0.4, color=hist_est_color, alpha=0.7, label="Sampled")
1698                axs[0].set_xticks(np.arange(len(unique_vals)))
1699                axs[0].set_xticklabels(unique_vals, rotation=45)
1700                axs[0].set_xlabel("Category")
1701                axs[0].set_ylabel("Relative Frequency")
1702                axs[0].set_title(f"Categorical bar plot for {node}")
1703                axs[0].legend()
1704                axs[0].grid(True, ls="--", alpha=0.4)
1705                axs[1].axis("off")
1706
1707            plt.tight_layout()
1708            plt.show()
1709
1710    ## SUMMARY METHODS
1711    def nll(self,data,variables=None):
1712        """
1713        Compute the Negative Log-Likelihood (NLL) for all or selected TRAM nodes.
1714
1715        This function evaluates trained TRAM models for each specified variable (node) 
1716        on the provided dataset. It performs forward passes onlyâ€”no training, no weight 
1717        updatesâ€”and returns the mean NLL per node.
1718
1719        Parameters
1720        ----------
1721        data : object
1722            Input dataset or data source compatible with `_ensure_dataset`, containing 
1723            both inputs and targets for each node.
1724        variables : list[str], optional
1725            List of variable (node) names to evaluate. If None, all nodes in 
1726            `self.models` are evaluated.
1727
1728        Returns
1729        -------
1730        dict[str, float]
1731            Dictionary mapping each node name to its average NLL value.
1732
1733        Notes
1734        -----
1735        - Each model is evaluated independently on its respective DataLoader.
1736        - The normalization values (`min_max`) for each node are retrieved from 
1737          `self.minmax_dict[node]`.
1738        - The function uses `evaluate_tramdag_model()` for per-node evaluation.
1739        - Expected directory structure:
1740              `<EXPERIMENT_DIR>/<node>/`
1741          where each node directory contains the trained model.
1742        """
1743
1744        td_data = self._ensure_dataset(data, is_val=True)  
1745        variables_list = variables if variables != None else list(self.models.keys())
1746        nll_dict = {}
1747        for node in variables_list:  
1748                min_vals = torch.tensor(self.minmax_dict[node][0], dtype=torch.float32)
1749                max_vals = torch.tensor(self.minmax_dict[node][1], dtype=torch.float32)
1750                min_max = torch.stack([min_vals, max_vals], dim=0)
1751                data_loader = td_data.loaders[node]
1752                model = self.models[node]
1753                EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
1754                NODE_DIR = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, f"{node}")
1755                nll= evaluate_tramdag_model(node=node,
1756                                            target_nodes=self.nodes_dict,
1757                                            NODE_DIR=NODE_DIR,
1758                                            tram_model=model,
1759                                            data_loader=data_loader,
1760                                            min_max=min_max)
1761                nll_dict[node]=nll
1762        return nll_dict
1763    
1764    def get_train_val_nll(self, node: str, mode: str) -> tuple[float, float]:
1765        """
1766        Retrieve training and validation NLL for a node and a given model state.
1767
1768        Parameters
1769        ----------
1770        node : str
1771            Node name.
1772        mode : {"best", "last", "init"}
1773            State of interest:
1774            - "best": epoch with lowest validation NLL.
1775            - "last": final epoch.
1776            - "init": first epoch (index 0).
1777
1778        Returns
1779        -------
1780        tuple of (float or None, float or None)
1781            A tuple ``(train_nll, val_nll)`` for the requested mode.
1782            Returns ``(None, None)`` if loss files are missing or cannot be read.
1783
1784        Notes
1785        -----
1786        This method expects per-node JSON files:
1787
1788        - ``train_loss_hist.json``
1789        - ``val_loss_hist.json``
1790
1791        in the node directory.
1792        """
1793        NODE_DIR = os.path.join(self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"], node)
1794        train_path = os.path.join(NODE_DIR, "train_loss_hist.json")
1795        val_path = os.path.join(NODE_DIR, "val_loss_hist.json")
1796
1797        if not os.path.exists(train_path) or not os.path.exists(val_path):
1798            if getattr(self, "debug", False):
1799                print(f"[DEBUG] Missing loss files for node '{node}'. Returning None.")
1800            return None, None
1801
1802        try:
1803            with open(train_path, "r") as f:
1804                train_hist = json.load(f)
1805            with open(val_path, "r") as f:
1806                val_hist = json.load(f)
1807
1808            train_nlls = np.array(train_hist)
1809            val_nlls = np.array(val_hist)
1810
1811            if mode == "init":
1812                idx = 0
1813            elif mode == "last":
1814                idx = len(val_nlls) - 1
1815            elif mode == "best":
1816                idx = int(np.argmin(val_nlls))
1817            else:
1818                raise ValueError(f"Invalid mode '{mode}' â€” must be one of 'best', 'last', 'init'.")
1819
1820            train_nll = float(train_nlls[idx])
1821            val_nll = float(val_nlls[idx])
1822            return train_nll, val_nll
1823
1824        except Exception as e:
1825            print(f"[ERROR] Failed to load NLLs for node '{node}' ({mode}): {e}")
1826            return None, None
1827
1828    def get_thetas(self, node: str, state: str = "best"):
1829        """
1830        Return transformed intercept (theta) parameters for a node and state.
1831
1832        Parameters
1833        ----------
1834        node : str
1835            Node name.
1836        state : {"best", "last", "init"}, optional
1837            Model state for which to return parameters. Default is "best".
1838
1839        Returns
1840        -------
1841        Any or None
1842            Transformed theta parameters for the requested node and state.
1843            The exact structure (scalar, list, or other) depends on the model.
1844
1845        Raises
1846        ------
1847        ValueError
1848            If an invalid state is given (not in {"best", "last", "init"}).
1849
1850        Notes
1851        -----
1852        Intercept dictionaries are cached on the instance under the attribute
1853        ``intercept_dicts``. If missing or incomplete, they are recomputed using
1854        `get_simple_intercepts_dict`.
1855        """
1856
1857        state = state.lower()
1858        if state not in ["best", "last", "init"]:
1859            raise ValueError(f"[ERROR] Invalid state '{state}'. Must be one of ['best', 'last', 'init'].")
1860
1861        dict_attr = "intercept_dicts"
1862
1863        # If no cached intercepts exist, compute them
1864        if not hasattr(self, dict_attr):
1865            if getattr(self, "debug", False):
1866                print(f"[DEBUG] '{dict_attr}' not found, computing via get_simple_intercepts_dict().")
1867            setattr(self, dict_attr, self.get_simple_intercepts_dict())
1868
1869        all_dicts = getattr(self, dict_attr)
1870
1871        # If the requested state isnâ€™t cached, recompute
1872        if state not in all_dicts:
1873            if getattr(self, "debug", False):
1874                print(f"[DEBUG] State '{state}' not found in cached intercepts, recomputing full dict.")
1875            setattr(self, dict_attr, self.get_simple_intercepts_dict())
1876            all_dicts = getattr(self, dict_attr)
1877
1878        state_dict = all_dicts.get(state, {})
1879
1880        # Return cached node intercept if present
1881        if node in state_dict:
1882            return state_dict[node]
1883
1884        # If not found, recompute full dict as fallback
1885        if getattr(self, "debug", False):
1886            print(f"[DEBUG] Node '{node}' not found in state '{state}', recomputing full dict.")
1887        setattr(self, dict_attr, self.get_simple_intercepts_dict())
1888        all_dicts = getattr(self, dict_attr)
1889        return all_dicts.get(state, {}).get(node, None)
1890        
1891    def get_linear_shifts(self, node: str, state: str = "best"):
1892        """
1893        Return learned linear shift terms for a node and a given state.
1894
1895        Parameters
1896        ----------
1897        node : str
1898            Node name.
1899        state : {"best", "last", "init"}, optional
1900            Model state for which to return linear shift terms. Default is "best".
1901
1902        Returns
1903        -------
1904        dict or Any or None
1905            Linear shift terms for the given node and state. Usually a dict
1906            mapping term names to weights.
1907
1908        Raises
1909        ------
1910        ValueError
1911            If an invalid state is given (not in {"best", "last", "init"}).
1912
1913        Notes
1914        -----
1915        Linear shift dictionaries are cached on the instance under the attribute
1916        ``linear_shift_dicts``. If missing or incomplete, they are recomputed using
1917        `get_linear_shifts_dict`.
1918        """
1919        state = state.lower()
1920        if state not in ["best", "last", "init"]:
1921            raise ValueError(f"[ERROR] Invalid state '{state}'. Must be one of ['best', 'last', 'init'].")
1922
1923        dict_attr = "linear_shift_dicts"
1924
1925        # If no global dicts cached, compute once
1926        if not hasattr(self, dict_attr):
1927            if getattr(self, "debug", False):
1928                print(f"[DEBUG] '{dict_attr}' not found, computing via get_linear_shifts_dict().")
1929            setattr(self, dict_attr, self.get_linear_shifts_dict())
1930
1931        all_dicts = getattr(self, dict_attr)
1932
1933        # If the requested state isn't cached, compute all again (covers fresh runs)
1934        if state not in all_dicts:
1935            if getattr(self, "debug", False):
1936                print(f"[DEBUG] State '{state}' not found in cached linear shifts, recomputing full dict.")
1937            setattr(self, dict_attr, self.get_linear_shifts_dict())
1938            all_dicts = getattr(self, dict_attr)
1939
1940        # Now fetch the dictionary for this state
1941        state_dict = all_dicts.get(state, {})
1942
1943        # If the node is available, return its entry
1944        if node in state_dict:
1945            return state_dict[node]
1946
1947        # If missing, try recomputing (fallback)
1948        if getattr(self, "debug", False):
1949            print(f"[DEBUG] Node '{node}' not found in state '{state}', recomputing full dict.")
1950        setattr(self, dict_attr, self.get_linear_shifts_dict())
1951        all_dicts = getattr(self, dict_attr)
1952        return all_dicts.get(state, {}).get(node, None)
1953
1954    def get_linear_shifts_dict(self):
1955        """
1956        Compute linear shift term dictionaries for all nodes and states.
1957
1958        For each node and each available state ("best", "last", "init"), this
1959        method loads the corresponding model checkpoint, extracts linear shift
1960        weights from the TRAM model, and stores them in a nested dictionary.
1961
1962        Returns
1963        -------
1964        dict
1965            Nested dictionary of the form:
1966
1967            .. code-block:: python
1968
1969                {
1970                    "best": {node: {...}},
1971                    "last": {node: {...}},
1972                    "init": {node: {...}},
1973                }
1974
1975            where the innermost dict maps term labels (e.g. ``"ls(parent_name)"``)
1976            to their weights.
1977
1978        Notes
1979        -----
1980        - If "best" or "last" checkpoints are unavailable for a node, only
1981        the "init" entry is populated.
1982        - Empty outer states (without any nodes) are removed from the result.
1983        """
1984
1985        EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
1986        nodes_list = list(self.models.keys())
1987        all_states = ["best", "last", "init"]
1988        all_linear_shift_dicts = {state: {} for state in all_states}
1989
1990        for node in nodes_list:
1991            NODE_DIR = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, node)
1992            BEST_MODEL_PATH, LAST_MODEL_PATH, _, _ = model_train_val_paths(NODE_DIR)
1993            INIT_MODEL_PATH = os.path.join(NODE_DIR, "initial_model.pt")
1994
1995            state_paths = {
1996                "best": BEST_MODEL_PATH,
1997                "last": LAST_MODEL_PATH,
1998                "init": INIT_MODEL_PATH,
1999            }
2000
2001            for state, LOAD_PATH in state_paths.items():
2002                if not os.path.exists(LOAD_PATH):
2003                    if state != "init":
2004                        # skip best/last if unavailable
2005                        continue
2006                    else:
2007                        print(f"[WARNING] No models found for node '{node}'. Only initial model will be used.")
2008                        if not os.path.exists(LOAD_PATH):
2009                            if getattr(self, "debug", False):
2010                                print(f"[DEBUG] Initial model also missing for node '{node}'. Skipping.")
2011                            continue
2012
2013                # Load parents and model
2014                _, terms_dict, _ = ordered_parents(node, self.nodes_dict)
2015                state_dict = torch.load(LOAD_PATH, map_location=self.device)
2016                tram_model = self.models[node]
2017                tram_model.load_state_dict(state_dict)
2018
2019                epoch_weights = {}
2020                if hasattr(tram_model, "nn_shift") and tram_model.nn_shift is not None:
2021                    for i, shift_layer in enumerate(tram_model.nn_shift):
2022                        module_name = shift_layer.__class__.__name__
2023                        if (
2024                            hasattr(shift_layer, "fc")
2025                            and hasattr(shift_layer.fc, "weight")
2026                            and module_name == "LinearShift"
2027                        ):
2028                            term_name = list(terms_dict.keys())[i]
2029                            epoch_weights[f"ls({term_name})"] = (
2030                                shift_layer.fc.weight.detach().cpu().squeeze().tolist()
2031                            )
2032                        elif getattr(self, "debug", False):
2033                            term_name = list(terms_dict.keys())[i]
2034                            print(f"[DEBUG] ls({term_name}): missing 'fc' or 'weight' in LinearShift.")
2035                else:
2036                    if getattr(self, "debug", False):
2037                        print(f"[DEBUG] Tram model for node '{node}' has no nn_shift or it is None.")
2038
2039                all_linear_shift_dicts[state][node] = epoch_weights
2040
2041        # Remove empty states (e.g., when best/last not found for all nodes)
2042        all_linear_shift_dicts = {k: v for k, v in all_linear_shift_dicts.items() if v}
2043
2044        return all_linear_shift_dicts
2045
2046    def get_simple_intercepts_dict(self):
2047        """
2048        Compute transformed simple intercept dictionaries for all nodes and states.
2049
2050        For each node and each available state ("best", "last", "init"), this
2051        method loads the corresponding model checkpoint, extracts simple intercept
2052        weights, transforms them into interpretable theta parameters, and stores
2053        them in a nested dictionary.
2054
2055        Returns
2056        -------
2057        dict
2058            Nested dictionary of the form:
2059
2060            .. code-block:: python
2061
2062                {
2063                    "best": {node: [[theta_1], [theta_2], ...]},
2064                    "last": {node: [[theta_1], [theta_2], ...]},
2065                    "init": {node: [[theta_1], [theta_2], ...]},
2066                }
2067
2068        Notes
2069        -----
2070        - For ordinal models (``self.is_ontram == True``), `transform_intercepts_ordinal`
2071        is used.
2072        - For continuous models, `transform_intercepts_continous` is used.
2073        - Empty outer states (without any nodes) are removed from the result.
2074        """
2075
2076        EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
2077        nodes_list = list(self.models.keys())
2078        all_states = ["best", "last", "init"]
2079        all_si_intercept_dicts = {state: {} for state in all_states}
2080
2081        debug = getattr(self, "debug", False)
2082        verbose = getattr(self, "verbose", False)
2083        is_ontram = getattr(self, "is_ontram", False)
2084
2085        for node in nodes_list:
2086            NODE_DIR = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, node)
2087            BEST_MODEL_PATH, LAST_MODEL_PATH, _, _ = model_train_val_paths(NODE_DIR)
2088            INIT_MODEL_PATH = os.path.join(NODE_DIR, "initial_model.pt")
2089
2090            state_paths = {
2091                "best": BEST_MODEL_PATH,
2092                "last": LAST_MODEL_PATH,
2093                "init": INIT_MODEL_PATH,
2094            }
2095
2096            for state, LOAD_PATH in state_paths.items():
2097                if not os.path.exists(LOAD_PATH):
2098                    if state != "init":
2099                        continue
2100                    else:
2101                        print(f"[WARNING] No models found for node '{node}'. Only initial model will be used.")
2102                        if not os.path.exists(LOAD_PATH):
2103                            if debug:
2104                                print(f"[DEBUG] Initial model also missing for node '{node}'. Skipping.")
2105                            continue
2106
2107                # Load model state
2108                state_dict = torch.load(LOAD_PATH, map_location=self.device)
2109                tram_model = self.models[node]
2110                tram_model.load_state_dict(state_dict)
2111
2112                # Extract and transform simple intercept weights
2113                si_weights = None
2114                if hasattr(tram_model, "nn_int") and tram_model.nn_int is not None and isinstance(tram_model.nn_int, SimpleIntercept):
2115                    if hasattr(tram_model.nn_int, "fc") and hasattr(tram_model.nn_int.fc, "weight"):
2116                        weights = tram_model.nn_int.fc.weight.detach().cpu().tolist()
2117                        weights_tensor = torch.Tensor(weights)
2118
2119                        if debug:
2120                            print(f"[DEBUG] Node '{node}' ({state}) theta tilde shape: {weights_tensor.shape}")
2121
2122                        if is_ontram:
2123                            si_weights = transform_intercepts_ordinal(weights_tensor.reshape(1, -1))[:, 1:-1].reshape(-1, 1)
2124                        else:
2125                            si_weights = transform_intercepts_continous(weights_tensor.reshape(1, -1)).reshape(-1, 1)
2126
2127                        si_weights = si_weights.tolist()
2128
2129                        if debug:
2130                            print(f"[DEBUG] Node '{node}' ({state}) theta transformed: {si_weights}")
2131                    else:
2132                        if debug:
2133                            print(f"[DEBUG] Node '{node}' ({state}): missing 'fc' or 'weight' in SimpleIntercept.")
2134                else:
2135                    if debug:
2136                        print(f"[DEBUG] Tram model for node '{node}' has no nn_int or it is None.")
2137
2138                all_si_intercept_dicts[state][node] = si_weights
2139
2140        # Clean up empty states
2141        all_si_intercept_dicts = {k: v for k, v in all_si_intercept_dicts.items() if v}
2142        return all_si_intercept_dicts
2143

2145        """

2147

2161        -------
2162        None

2188

2190                best_train_nll, best_val_nll = self.get_train_val_nll(node, "best")
2191                last_train_nll, last_val_nll = self.get_train_val_nll(node, "last")
2192                n_epochs_total = len(json.load(open(train_path)))
2193            else:
2194                best_train_nll = best_val_nll = last_train_nll = last_val_nll = None
2195                n_epochs_total = 0
2196

2198                "Node": node,
2199                "Best Train NLL": best_train_nll,
2200                "Best Val NLL": best_val_nll,
2201                "Last Train NLL": last_train_nll,
2202                "Last Val NLL": last_val_nll,
2203                "Epochs": n_epochs_total,
2204            })
2205

2207        df_summary = df_summary.round(4)
2208
2209        print("\n[1] TRAINING METRICS OVERVIEW")
2210        print("-" * 120)

2212            print(
2213                df_summary.to_string(
2214                    index=False,
2215                    justify="center",
2216                    col_space=14,
2217                    float_format=lambda x: f"{x:7.4f}",
2218                )
2219            )
2220        else:
2221            print("No training history found for any node.")
2222        print("-" * 120)
2223
2224        # ---------- NODE DETAILS ----------
2225        print("\n[2] NODE-SPECIFIC DETAILS")
2226        print("-" * 120)
2227        for node in self.models.keys():
2228            print(f"\n{f'NODE: {node}':^120}")
2229            print("-" * 120)
2230
2231            # THETAS & SHIFTS
2232            for state in ["init", "last", "best"]:
2233                print(f"\n  [{state.upper()} STATE]")
2234
2235                # ---- Thetas ----
2236                try:
2237                    thetas = getattr(self, "get_thetas", lambda n, s=None: None)(node, state)
2238                    if thetas is not None:
2239                        if isinstance(thetas, (list, np.ndarray, pd.Series)):
2240                            thetas_flat = np.array(thetas).flatten()
2241                            compact = np.round(thetas_flat, 4)
2242                            arr_str = np.array2string(
2243                                compact,
2244                                max_line_width=110,
2245                                threshold=np.inf,
2246                                separator=", "
2247                            )
2248                            lines = arr_str.split("\n")
2249                            if len(lines) > 2:
2250                                arr_str = "\n".join(lines[:2]) + " ..."
2251                            print(f"    Î˜ ({len(thetas_flat)}): {arr_str}")
2252                        elif isinstance(thetas, dict):

2254                                print(f"     Î˜[{k}]: {v}")
2255                        else:
2256                            print(f"    Î˜: {thetas}")

2258                        print("    Î˜: not available")

2260                    print(f"    [Error loading thetas] {e}")

2294

2296                    sampling_exists = os.path.isdir(sampling_dir) and len(os.listdir(sampling_dir)) > 0
2297                    print(f"    Sampling results found: {sampling_exists}")
2298
2299                    for label, filename in [("Train", "train_loss_hist.json"), ("Validation", "val_loss_hist.json")]:
2300                        path = os.path.join(node_dir, filename)
2301                        if os.path.exists(path):
2302                            try:
2303                                with open(path, "r") as f:
2304                                    hist = json.load(f)
2305                                print(f"    {label} history: {len(hist)} epochs")
2306                            except Exception as e:
2307                                print(f"    {label} history: failed to load ({e})")
2308                        else:
2309                            print(f"    {label} history: not found")
2310                else:
2311                    print("    [INFO] No experiment directory defined or missing for this node.")
2312            print("-" * 120)
2313
2314        # ---------- TRAINING DATAFRAME ----------
2315        print("\n[3] TRAINING DATAFRAME")
2316        print("-" * 120)
2317        try:

2319        except AttributeError:
2320            print("No training DataFrame attached to this TramDagModel.")
2321        print("=" * 120 + "\n")
class TramDagModel: 
  66class TramDagModel:
  67    """
  68    Probabilistic DAG model built from node-wise TRAMs (transformation models).
  69
  70    This class manages:
  71    - Configuration and per-node model construction.
  72    - Data scaling (minâ€“max).
  73    - Training (sequential or per-node parallel on CPU).
  74    - Diagnostics (loss history, intercepts, linear shifts, latents).
  75    - Sampling from the joint DAG and loading stored samples.
  76    - High-level summaries and plotting utilities.
  77    """
  78    
  79    # ---- defaults used at construction time ----
  80    DEFAULTS_CONFIG = {
  81        "set_initial_weights": False,
  82        "debug":False,
  83        "verbose": False,
  84        "device":'auto',
  85        "initial_data":None,
  86        "overwrite_initial_weights": True,
  87    }
  88
  89    # ---- defaults used at fit() time ----
  90    DEFAULTS_FIT = {
  91        "epochs": 100,
  92        "train_list": None,
  93        "callbacks": None,
  94        "learning_rate": 0.01,
  95        "device": "auto",
  96        "optimizers": None,
  97        "schedulers": None,
  98        "use_scheduler": False,
  99        "save_linear_shifts": True,
 100        "save_simple_intercepts": True,
 101        "debug":False,
 102        "verbose": True,
 103        "train_mode": "sequential",  # or "parallel"
 104        "return_history": False,
 105        "overwrite_inital_weights": True,

 113    def __init__(self):
 114        """
 115        Initialize an empty TramDagModel shell.
 116
 117        Notes
 118        -----
 119        This constructor does not build any node models and does not attach a
 120        configuration. Use `TramDagModel.from_config` or `TramDagModel.from_directory`
 121        to obtain a fully configured and ready-to-use instance.
 122        """
 123        
 124        self.debug = False
 125        self.verbose = False
 126        self.device = 'auto'
 127        pass

 129    @staticmethod
 130    def get_device(settings):
 131        """
 132        Resolve the target device string from a settings dictionary.
 133
 134        Parameters
 135        ----------
 136        settings : dict
 137            Dictionary containing at least a key ``"device"`` with one of
 138            {"auto", "cpu", "cuda"}. If missing, "auto" is assumed.
 139
 140        Returns
 141        -------
 142        str
 143            Device string, either "cpu" or "cuda".
 144
 145        Notes
 146        -----
 147        If ``device == "auto"``, CUDA is selected if available, otherwise CPU.
 148        """
 149        device_arg = settings.get("device", "auto")
 150        if device_arg == "auto":
 151            device_str = "cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu"
 152        else:
 153            device_str = device_arg
 154        return device_str
