 156    def _validate_kwargs(self, kwargs: dict, defaults_attr: str = "DEFAULTS_FIT", context: str = None):
 157        """
 158        Validate a kwargs dictionary against a class-level defaults dictionary.
 159
 160        Parameters
 161        ----------
 162        kwargs : dict
 163            Keyword arguments to validate.
 164        defaults_attr : str, optional
 165            Name of the attribute on this class that contains the allowed keys,
 166            e.g. ``"DEFAULTS_CONFIG"`` or ``"DEFAULTS_FIT"``. Default is "DEFAULTS_FIT".
 167        context : str or None, optional
 168            Optional label (e.g. caller name) to prepend in error messages.
 169
 170        Raises
 171        ------
 172        AttributeError
 173            If the attribute named by ``defaults_attr`` does not exist.
 174        ValueError
 175            If any key in ``kwargs`` is not present in the corresponding defaults dict.
 176        """
 177        defaults = getattr(self, defaults_attr, None)
 178        if defaults is None:
 179            raise AttributeError(f"{self.__class__.__name__} has no attribute '{defaults_attr}'")
 180
 181        unknown = set(kwargs) - set(defaults)
 182        if unknown:
 183            prefix = f"[{context}] " if context else ""
 184            raise ValueError(f"{prefix}Unknown parameter(s): {', '.join(sorted(unknown))}")
 185            
 186    ## CREATE A TRAMDADMODEL
 187    @classmethod
 188    def from_config(cls, cfg, **kwargs):
 189        """
 190        Construct a TramDagModel from a TramDagConfig object.
 191
 192        This builds one TRAM model per node in the DAG and optionally writes
 193        the initial model parameters to disk.
 194
 195        Parameters
 196        ----------
 197        cfg : TramDagConfig
 198            Configuration wrapper holding the underlying configuration dictionary,
 199            including at least:
 200            - ``conf_dict["nodes"]``: mapping of node names to node configs.
 201            - ``conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]``: experiment directory.
 202        **kwargs
 203            Node-level construction options. Each key must be present in
 204            ``DEFAULTS_CONFIG``. Values can be:
 205            - scalar: applied to all nodes.
 206            - dict: mapping ``{node_name: value}`` for per-node overrides.
 207
 208            Common keys include:
 209            device : {"auto", "cpu", "cuda"}, default "auto"
 210                Device selection (CUDA if available when "auto").
 211            debug : bool, default False
 212                If True, print debug messages.
 213            verbose : bool, default False
 214                If True, print informational messages.
 215            set_initial_weights : bool
 216                Passed to underlying TRAM model constructors.
 217            overwrite_initial_weights : bool, default True
 218                If True, overwrite any existing ``initial_model.pt`` files per node.
 219            initial_data : Any
 220                Optional object passed down to node constructors.
 221
 222        Returns
 223        -------
 224        TramDagModel
 225            Fully initialized instance with:
 226            - ``cfg``
 227            - ``nodes_dict``
 228            - ``models`` (per-node TRAMs)
 229            - ``settings`` (resolved per-node config)
 230
 231        Raises
 232        ------
 233        ValueError
 234            If any dict-valued kwarg does not provide values for exactly the set
 235            of nodes in ``cfg.conf_dict["nodes"]``.
 236        """
 237        
 238        self = cls()
 239        self.cfg = cfg
 240        self.cfg.update()  # ensure latest version from disk
 241        self.cfg._verify_completeness()
 242        
 243        
 244        try:
 245            self.cfg.save()  # persist back to disk
 246            if getattr(self, "debug", False):
 247                print("[DEBUG] Configuration updated and saved.")
 248        except Exception as e:
 249            print(f"[WARNING] Could not save configuration after update: {e}")        
 250            
 251        self.nodes_dict = self.cfg.conf_dict["nodes"] 
 252
 253        self._validate_kwargs(kwargs, defaults_attr='DEFAULTS_CONFIG', context="from_config")
 254
 255        # update defaults with kwargs
 256        settings = dict(cls.DEFAULTS_CONFIG)
 257        settings.update(kwargs)
 258
 259        # resolve device
 260        device_arg = settings.get("device", "auto")
 261        if device_arg == "auto":
 262            device_str = "cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu"
 263        else:
 264            device_str = device_arg
 265        self.device = torch.device(device_str)
 266
 267        # set flags on the instance so they are accessible later
 268        self.debug = settings.get("debug", False)
 269        self.verbose = settings.get("verbose", False)
 270
 271        if  self.debug:
 272            print(f"[DEBUG] TramDagModel using device: {self.device}")
 273            
 274        # initialize settings storage
 275        self.settings = {k: {} for k in settings.keys()}
 276
 277        # validate dict-typed args
 278        for k, v in settings.items():
 279            if isinstance(v, dict):
 280                expected = set(self.nodes_dict.keys())
 281                given = set(v.keys())
 282                if expected != given:
 283                    raise ValueError(
 284                        f"[ERROR] the provided argument '{k}' keys are not same as in cfg.conf_dict['nodes'].keys().\n"
 285                        f"Expected: {expected}, but got: {given}\n"
 286                        f"Please provide values for all variables.")
 287
 288        # build one model per node
 289        self.models = {}
 290        for node in self.nodes_dict.keys():
 291            per_node_kwargs = {}
 292            for k, v in settings.items():
 293                resolved = v[node] if isinstance(v, dict) else v
 294                per_node_kwargs[k] = resolved
 295                self.settings[k][node] = resolved
 296            if self.debug:
 297                print(f"\n[INFO] Building model for node '{node}' with settings: {per_node_kwargs}")
 298            self.models[node] = get_fully_specified_tram_model(
 299                node=node,
 300                configuration_dict=self.cfg.conf_dict,
 301                **per_node_kwargs)
 302            
 303            try:
 304                EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 305                NODE_DIR = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, f"{node}")
 306                os.makedirs(NODE_DIR, exist_ok=True)
 307
 308                model_path = os.path.join(NODE_DIR, "initial_model.pt")
 309                overwrite = settings.get("overwrite_initial_weights", True)
 310
 311                if overwrite or not os.path.exists(model_path):
 312                    torch.save(self.models[node].state_dict(), model_path)
 313                    if self.debug:
 314                        print(f"[DEBUG] Saved initial model state for node '{node}' to {model_path} (overwrite={overwrite})")
 315                else:
 316                    if self.debug:
 317                        print(f"[DEBUG] Skipped saving initial model for node '{node}' (already exists at {model_path})")
 318            except Exception as e:
 319                print(f"[ERROR] Could not save initial model state for node '{node}': {e}")
 320            
 321            TEMP_DIR = "temp"
 322            if os.path.isdir(TEMP_DIR) and not os.listdir(TEMP_DIR):
 323                os.rmdir(TEMP_DIR)
 324                            
 325        return self
 326
 327    @classmethod
 328    def from_directory(cls, EXPERIMENT_DIR: str, device: str = "auto", debug: bool = False, verbose: bool = False):
 329        """
 330        Reconstruct a TramDagModel from an experiment directory on disk.
 331
 332        This method:
 333        1. Loads the configuration JSON.
 334        2. Wraps it in a TramDagConfig.
 335        3. Builds all node models via `from_config`.
 336        4. Loads the minâ€“max scaling dictionary.
 337
 338        Parameters
 339        ----------
 340        EXPERIMENT_DIR : str
 341            Path to an experiment directory containing:
 342            - ``configuration.json``
 343            - ``min_max_scaling.json``.
 344        device : {"auto", "cpu", "cuda"}, optional
 345            Device selection. Default is "auto".
 346        debug : bool, optional
 347            If True, enable debug messages. Default is False.
 348        verbose : bool, optional
 349            If True, enable informational messages. Default is False.
 350
 351        Returns
 352        -------
 353        TramDagModel
 354            A TramDagModel instance with models, config, and scaling loaded.
 355
 356        Raises
 357        ------
 358        FileNotFoundError
 359            If configuration or minâ€“max files cannot be found.
 360        RuntimeError
 361            If the minâ€“max file cannot be read or parsed.
 362        """
 363
 364        # --- load config file ---
 365        config_path = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, "configuration.json")
 366        if not os.path.exists(config_path):
 367            raise FileNotFoundError(f"[ERROR] Config file not found at {config_path}")
 368
 369        with open(config_path, "r") as f:
 370            cfg_dict = json.load(f)
 371
 372        # Create TramConfig wrapper 
 373        cfg = TramDagConfig(cfg_dict, CONF_DICT_PATH=config_path)
 374
 375        # --- build model from config ---
 376        self = cls.from_config(cfg, device=device, debug=debug, verbose=verbose, overwrite_initial_weights=False)
 377
 378        # --- load minmax scaling ---
 379        minmax_path = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, "min_max_scaling.json")
 380        if not os.path.exists(minmax_path):
 381            raise FileNotFoundError(f"[ERROR] MinMax file not found at {minmax_path}")
 382
 383        with open(minmax_path, "r") as f:
 384            self.minmax_dict = json.load(f)
 385
 386        if self.verbose or self.debug:
 387            print(f"[INFO] Loaded TramDagModel from {EXPERIMENT_DIR}")
 388            print(f"[INFO] Config loaded from {config_path}")
 389            print(f"[INFO] MinMax scaling loaded from {minmax_path}")
 390
 391        return self
 392
 393    def _ensure_dataset(self, data, is_val=False,**kwargs):
 394        """
 395        Ensure that the input data is represented as a TramDagDataset.
 396
 397        Parameters
 398        ----------
 399        data : pandas.DataFrame, TramDagDataset, or None
 400            Input data to be converted or passed through.
 401        is_val : bool, optional
 402            If True, the resulting dataset is treated as validation data
 403            (e.g. no shuffling). Default is False.
 404        **kwargs
 405            Additional keyword arguments passed through to
 406            ``TramDagDataset.from_dataframe``.
 407
 408        Returns
 409        -------
 410        TramDagDataset or None
 411            A TramDagDataset if ``data`` is a DataFrame or TramDagDataset,
 412            otherwise None if ``data`` is None.
 413
 414        Raises
 415        ------
 416        TypeError
 417            If ``data`` is not a DataFrame, TramDagDataset, or None.
 418        """
 419                
 420        if isinstance(data, pd.DataFrame):
 421            return TramDagDataset.from_dataframe(data, self.cfg, shuffle=not is_val,**kwargs)
 422        elif isinstance(data, TramDagDataset):
 423            return data
 424        elif data is None:
 425            return None
 426        else:
 427            raise TypeError(
 428                f"[ERROR] data must be pd.DataFrame, TramDagDataset, or None, got {type(data)}"
 429            )
 430
 431    def load_or_compute_minmax(self, td_train_data=None,use_existing=False, write=True):
 432        """
 433        Load an existing Minâ€“Max scaling dictionary from disk or compute a new one 
 434        from the provided training dataset.
 435
 436        Parameters
 437        ----------
 438        use_existing : bool, optional (default=False)
 439            If True, attempts to load an existing `min_max_scaling.json` file 
 440            from the experiment directory. Raises an error if the file is missing 
 441            or unreadable.
 442
 443        write : bool, optional (default=True)
 444            If True, writes the computed Minâ€“Max scaling dictionary to 
 445            `<EXPERIMENT_DIR>/min_max_scaling.json`.
 446
 447        td_train_data : object, optional
 448            Training dataset used to compute scaling statistics. If not provided,
 449            the method will ensure or construct it via `_ensure_dataset(data=..., is_val=False)`.
 450
 451        Behavior
 452        --------
 453        - If `use_existing=True`, loads the JSON file containing previously saved 
 454          minâ€“max values and stores it in `self.minmax_dict`.
 455        - If `use_existing=False`, computes a new scaling dictionary using 
 456          `td_train_data.compute_scaling()` and stores the result in 
 457          `self.minmax_dict`.
 458        - Optionally writes the computed dictionary to disk.
 459
 460        Side Effects
 461        -------------
 462        - Populates `self.minmax_dict` with scaling values.
 463        - Writes or loads the file `min_max_scaling.json` under 
 464          `<EXPERIMENT_DIR>`.
 465        - Prints diagnostic output if `self.debug` or `self.verbose` is True.
 466
 467        Raises
 468        ------
 469        FileNotFoundError
 470            If `use_existing=True` but the minâ€“max file does not exist.
 471
 472        RuntimeError
 473            If an existing minâ€“max file cannot be read or parsed.
 474
 475        Notes
 476        -----
 477        The computed minâ€“max dictionary is expected to contain scaling statistics 
 478        per feature, typically in the form:
 479            {
 480                "node": {"min": float, "max": float},
 481                ...
 482            }
 483        """
 484        EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 485        minmax_path = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, "min_max_scaling.json")
 486
 487        # laod exisitng if possible
 488        if use_existing:
 489            if not os.path.exists(minmax_path):
 490                raise FileNotFoundError(f"MinMax file not found: {minmax_path}")
 491            try:
 492                with open(minmax_path, 'r') as f:
 493                    self.minmax_dict = json.load(f)
 494                if self.debug or self.verbose:
 495                    print(f"[INFO] Loaded existing minmax dict from {minmax_path}")
 496                return
 497            except Exception as e:
 498                raise RuntimeError(f"Could not load existing minmax dict: {e}")
 499
 500        # 
 501        if self.debug or self.verbose:
 502            print("[INFO] Computing new minmax dict from training data...")
 503            
 504        td_train_data=self._ensure_dataset( data=td_train_data, is_val=False)    
 505            
 506        self.minmax_dict = td_train_data.compute_scaling()
 507
 508        if write:
 509            os.makedirs(EXPERIMENT_DIR, exist_ok=True)
 510            with open(minmax_path, 'w') as f:
 511                json.dump(self.minmax_dict, f, indent=4)
 512            if self.debug or self.verbose:
 513                print(f"[INFO] Saved new minmax dict to {minmax_path}")
 514
 515    ## FIT METHODS
 516    @staticmethod
 517    def _fit_single_node(node, self_ref, settings, td_train_data, td_val_data, device_str):
 518        """
 519        Train a single node model (helper for per-node training).
 520
 521        This method is designed to be called either from the main process
 522        (sequential training) or from a joblib worker (parallel CPU training).
 523
 524        Parameters
 525        ----------
 526        node : str
 527            Name of the target node to train.
 528        self_ref : TramDagModel
 529            Reference to the TramDagModel instance containing models and config.
 530        settings : dict
 531            Training settings dictionary, typically derived from ``DEFAULTS_FIT``
 532            plus any user overrides.
 533        td_train_data : TramDagDataset
 534            Training dataset with node-specific DataLoaders in ``.loaders``.
 535        td_val_data : TramDagDataset or None
 536            Validation dataset or None.
 537        device_str : str
 538            Device string, e.g. "cpu" or "cuda".
 539
 540        Returns
 541        -------
 542        tuple
 543            A tuple ``(node, history)`` where:
 544            node : str
 545                Node name.
 546            history : dict or Any
 547                Training history as returned by ``train_val_loop``.
 548        """
 549        torch.set_num_threads(1)  # prevent thread oversubscription
 550
 551        model = self_ref.models[node]
 552
 553        # Resolve per-node settings
 554        def _resolve(key):
 555            val = settings[key]
 556            return val[node] if isinstance(val, dict) else val
 557
 558        node_epochs = _resolve("epochs")
 559        node_lr = _resolve("learning_rate")
 560        node_debug = _resolve("debug")
 561        node_save_linear_shifts = _resolve("save_linear_shifts")
 562        save_simple_intercepts  = _resolve("save_simple_intercepts")
 563        node_verbose = _resolve("verbose")
 564
 565        # Optimizer & scheduler
 566        if settings["optimizers"] and node in settings["optimizers"]:
 567            optimizer = settings["optimizers"][node]
 568        else:
 569            optimizer = Adam(model.parameters(), lr=node_lr)
 570
 571        scheduler = settings["schedulers"].get(node, None) if settings["schedulers"] else None
 572
 573        # Data loaders
 574        train_loader = td_train_data.loaders[node]
 575        val_loader = td_val_data.loaders[node] if td_val_data else None
 576
 577        # Min-max scaling tensors
 578        min_vals = torch.tensor(self_ref.minmax_dict[node][0], dtype=torch.float32)
 579        max_vals = torch.tensor(self_ref.minmax_dict[node][1], dtype=torch.float32)
 580        min_max = torch.stack([min_vals, max_vals], dim=0)
 581
 582        # Node directory
 583        try:
 584            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self_ref.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 585            NODE_DIR = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, f"{node}")
 586        except Exception:
 587            NODE_DIR = os.path.join("models", node)
 588            print("[WARNING] No log directory specified in config, saving to default location.")
 589        os.makedirs(NODE_DIR, exist_ok=True)
 590
 591        if node_verbose:
 592            print(f"\n[INFO] Training node '{node}' for {node_epochs} epochs on {device_str} (pid={os.getpid()})")
 593
 594        # --- train ---
 595        history = train_val_loop(
 596            node=node,
 597            target_nodes=self_ref.nodes_dict,
 598            NODE_DIR=NODE_DIR,
 599            tram_model=model,
 600            train_loader=train_loader,
 601            val_loader=val_loader,
 602            epochs=node_epochs,
 603            optimizer=optimizer,
 604            use_scheduler=(scheduler is not None),
 605            scheduler=scheduler,
 606            save_linear_shifts=node_save_linear_shifts,
 607            save_simple_intercepts=save_simple_intercepts,
 608            verbose=node_verbose,
 609            device=torch.device(device_str),
 610            debug=node_debug,
 611            min_max=min_max)
 612        return node, history
 613
 614    def fit(self, train_data, val_data=None, **kwargs):
 615        """
 616        Train TRAM models for all nodes in the DAG.
 617
 618        Coordinates dataset preparation, minâ€“max scaling, and per-node training,
 619        optionally in parallel on CPU.
 620
 621        Parameters
 622        ----------
 623        train_data : pandas.DataFrame or TramDagDataset
 624            Training data. If a DataFrame is given, it is converted into a
 625            TramDagDataset using `_ensure_dataset`.
 626        val_data : pandas.DataFrame or TramDagDataset or None, optional
 627            Validation data. If a DataFrame is given, it is converted into a
 628            TramDagDataset. If None, no validation loss is computed.
 629        **kwargs
 630            Overrides for ``DEFAULTS_FIT``. All keys must exist in
 631            ``DEFAULTS_FIT``. Common options:
 632
 633            epochs : int, default 100
 634                Number of training epochs per node.
 635            learning_rate : float, default 0.01
 636                Learning rate for the default Adam optimizer.
 637            train_list : list of str or None, optional
 638                List of node names to train. If None, all nodes are trained.
 639            train_mode : {"sequential", "parallel"}, default "sequential"
 640                Training mode. "parallel" uses joblib-based CPU multiprocessing.
 641                GPU forces sequential mode.
 642            device : {"auto", "cpu", "cuda"}, default "auto"
 643                Device selection.
 644            optimizers : dict or None
 645                Optional mapping ``{node_name: optimizer}``. If provided for a
 646                node, that optimizer is used instead of creating a new Adam.
 647            schedulers : dict or None
 648                Optional mapping ``{node_name: scheduler}``.
 649            use_scheduler : bool
 650                If True, enable scheduler usage in the training loop.
 651            num_workers : int
 652                DataLoader workers in sequential mode (ignored in parallel).
 653            persistent_workers : bool
 654                DataLoader persistence in sequential mode (ignored in parallel).
 655            prefetch_factor : int
 656                DataLoader prefetch factor (ignored in parallel).
 657            batch_size : int
 658                Batch size for all node DataLoaders.
 659            debug : bool
 660                Enable debug output.
 661            verbose : bool
 662                Enable informational logging.
 663            return_history : bool
 664                If True, return a history dict.
 665
 666        Returns
 667        -------
 668        dict or None
 669            If ``return_history=True``, a dictionary mapping each node name
 670            to its training history. Otherwise, returns None.
 671
 672        Raises
 673        ------
 674        ValueError
 675            If ``train_mode`` is not "sequential" or "parallel".
 676        """
 677        self._validate_kwargs(kwargs, defaults_attr='DEFAULTS_FIT', context="fit")
 678        
 679        # --- merge defaults ---
 680        settings = dict(self.DEFAULTS_FIT)
 681        settings.update(kwargs)
 682        
 683        
 684        self.debug = settings.get("debug", False)
 685        self.verbose = settings.get("verbose", False)
 686
 687        # --- resolve device ---
 688        device_str=self.get_device(settings)
 689        self.device = torch.device(device_str)
 690
 691        # --- training mode ---
 692        train_mode = settings.get("train_mode", "sequential").lower()
 693        if train_mode not in ("sequential", "parallel"):
 694            raise ValueError("train_mode must be 'sequential' or 'parallel'")
 695
 696        # --- DataLoader safety logic ---
 697        if train_mode == "parallel":
 698            # if user passed loader paralleling params, warn and override
 699            for flag in ("num_workers", "persistent_workers", "prefetch_factor"):
 700                if flag in kwargs:
 701                    print(f"[WARNING] '{flag}' is ignored in parallel mode "
 702                        f"(disabled to prevent nested multiprocessing).")
 703            # disable unsafe loader multiprocessing options
 704            settings["num_workers"] = 0
 705            settings["persistent_workers"] = False
 706            settings["prefetch_factor"] = None
 707        else:
 708            # sequential mode â†’ respect user DataLoader settings
 709            if self.debug:
 710                print("[DEBUG] Sequential mode: using DataLoader kwargs as provided.")
 711
 712        # --- which nodes to train ---
 713        train_list = settings.get("train_list") or list(self.models.keys())
 714
 715
 716        # --- dataset prep (receives adjusted settings) ---
 717        td_train_data = self._ensure_dataset(train_data, is_val=False, **settings)
 718        td_val_data = self._ensure_dataset(val_data, is_val=True, **settings)
 719
 720        # --- normalization ---
 721        self.load_or_compute_minmax(use_existing=False, write=True, td_train_data=td_train_data)
 722
 723        # --- print header ---
 724        if self.verbose or self.debug:
 725            print(f"[INFO] Training {len(train_list)} nodes ({train_mode}) on {device_str}")
 726
 727        # ======================================================================
 728        # Sequential mode  safe for GPU or debugging)
 729        # ======================================================================
 730        if train_mode == "sequential" or "cuda" in device_str:
 731            if "cuda" in device_str and train_mode == "parallel":
 732                print("[WARNING] GPU device detected â€” forcing sequential mode.")
 733            results = {}
 734            for node in train_list:
 735                node, history = self._fit_single_node(
 736                    node, self, settings, td_train_data, td_val_data, device_str
 737                )
 738                results[node] = history
 739        
 740
 741        # ======================================================================
 742        # parallel mode (CPU only)
 743        # ======================================================================
 744        if train_mode == "parallel":
 745
 746            n_jobs = min(len(train_list), os.cpu_count() // 2 or 1)
 747            if self.verbose or self.debug:
 748                print(f"[INFO] Using {n_jobs} CPU workers for parallel node training")
 749            parallel_outputs = Parallel(
 750                n_jobs=n_jobs,
 751                backend="loky",#loky, multiprocessing
 752                verbose=10,
 753                prefer="processes"
 754            )(delayed(self._fit_single_node)(node, self, settings, td_train_data, td_val_data, device_str) for node in train_list )
 755
 756            results = {node: hist for node, hist in parallel_outputs}
 757        
 758        if settings.get("return_history", False):
 759            return results
 760
 761    ## FIT-DIAGNOSTICS
 762    def loss_history(self):
 763        """
 764        Load training and validation loss history for all nodes.
 765
 766        Looks for per-node JSON files:
 767
 768        - ``EXPERIMENT_DIR/{node}/train_loss_hist.json``
 769        - ``EXPERIMENT_DIR/{node}/val_loss_hist.json``
 770
 771        Returns
 772        -------
 773        dict
 774            A dictionary mapping node names to:
 775
 776            .. code-block:: python
 777
 778                {
 779                    "train": list or None,
 780                    "validation": list or None
 781                }
 782
 783            where each list contains NLL values per epoch, or None if not found.
 784
 785        Raises
 786        ------
 787        ValueError
 788            If the experiment directory cannot be resolved from the configuration.
 789        """
 790        try:
 791            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 792        except KeyError:
 793            raise ValueError(
 794                "[ERROR] Missing 'EXPERIMENT_DIR' in cfg.conf_dict['PATHS']. "
 795                "History retrieval requires experiment logs."
 796            )
 797
 798        all_histories = {}
 799        for node in self.nodes_dict.keys():
 800            node_dir = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, node)
 801            train_path = os.path.join(node_dir, "train_loss_hist.json")
 802            val_path = os.path.join(node_dir, "val_loss_hist.json")
 803
 804            node_hist = {}
 805
 806            # --- load train history ---
 807            if os.path.exists(train_path):
 808                try:
 809                    with open(train_path, "r") as f:
 810                        node_hist["train"] = json.load(f)
 811                except Exception as e:
 812                    print(f"[WARNING] Could not load {train_path}: {e}")
 813                    node_hist["train"] = None
 814            else:
 815                node_hist["train"] = None
 816
 817            # --- load val history ---
 818            if os.path.exists(val_path):
 819                try:
 820                    with open(val_path, "r") as f:
 821                        node_hist["validation"] = json.load(f)
 822                except Exception as e:
 823                    print(f"[WARNING] Could not load {val_path}: {e}")
 824                    node_hist["validation"] = None
 825            else:
 826                node_hist["validation"] = None
 827
 828            all_histories[node] = node_hist
 829
 830        if self.verbose or self.debug:
 831            print(f"[INFO] Loaded training/validation histories for {len(all_histories)} nodes.")
 832
 833        return all_histories
 834
 835    def linear_shift_history(self):
 836        """
 837        Load linear shift term histories for all nodes.
 838
 839        Each node history is expected in a JSON file named
 840        ``linear_shifts_all_epochs.json`` under the node directory.
 841
 842        Returns
 843        -------
 844        dict
 845            A mapping ``{node_name: pandas.DataFrame}``, where each DataFrame
 846            contains linear shift weights across epochs.
 847
 848        Raises
 849        ------
 850        ValueError
 851            If the experiment directory cannot be resolved from the configuration.
 852
 853        Notes
 854        -----
 855        If a history file is missing for a node, a warning is printed and the
 856        node is omitted from the returned dictionary.
 857        """
 858        histories = {}
 859        try:
 860            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 861        except KeyError:
 862            raise ValueError(
 863                "[ERROR] Missing 'EXPERIMENT_DIR' in cfg.conf_dict['PATHS']. "
 864                "Cannot load histories without experiment directory."
 865            )
 866
 867        for node in self.nodes_dict.keys():
 868            node_dir = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, node)
 869            history_path = os.path.join(node_dir, "linear_shifts_all_epochs.json")
 870            if os.path.exists(history_path):
 871                histories[node] = pd.read_json(history_path)
 872            else:
 873                print(f"[WARNING] No linear shift history found for node '{node}' at {history_path}")
 874        return histories
 875

 893
 894        Notes
 895        -----
 896        If a history file is missing for a node, a warning is printed and the
 897        node is omitted from the returned dictionary.
 898        """
 899        histories = {}
 900        try:
 901            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 902        except KeyError:
 903            raise ValueError(
 904                "[ERROR] Missing 'EXPERIMENT_DIR' in cfg.conf_dict['PATHS']. "
 905                "Cannot load histories without experiment directory."
 906            )
 907

 909            node_dir = os.path.join(EXPERIMENT_DIR, node)
 910            history_path = os.path.join(node_dir, "simple_intercepts_all_epochs.json")

 917    def get_latent(self, df, verbose=False):
 918        """
 919        Compute latent representations for all nodes in the DAG.
 920
 921        Parameters
 922        ----------
 923        df : pandas.DataFrame
 924            Input data frame with columns corresponding to nodes in the DAG.
 925        verbose : bool, optional
 926            If True, print informational messages during latent computation.
 927            Default is False.
 928
 929        Returns
 930        -------
 931        pandas.DataFrame
 932            DataFrame containing the original columns plus latent variables
 933            for each node (e.g. columns named ``f"{node}_U"``).
 934
 935        Raises
 936        ------
 937        ValueError
 938            If the experiment directory is missing from the configuration or
 939            if ``self.minmax_dict`` has not been set.
 940        """
 941        try:
 942            EXPERIMENT_DIR = self.cfg.conf_dict["PATHS"]["EXPERIMENT_DIR"]
 943        except KeyError:
 944            raise ValueError(
 945                "[ERROR] Missing 'EXPERIMENT_DIR' in cfg.conf_dict['PATHS']. "
 946                "Latent extraction requires trained model checkpoints."
 947            )
 948
 949        # ensure minmax_dict is available
 950        if not hasattr(self, "minmax_dict"):
 951            raise ValueError(
 952                "[ERROR] minmax_dict not found in the TramDagModel instance. "
 953                "Either call .load_or_compute_minmax(td_train_data=train_df) or .fit() first."
 954            )
 955
 956        all_latents_df = create_latent_df_for_full_dag(
 957            configuration_dict=self.cfg.conf_dict,
 958            EXPERIMENT_DIR=EXPERIMENT_DIR,
 959            df=df,
 960            verbose=verbose,
 961            min_max_dict=self.minmax_dict,
 962        )
 963
 964        return all_latents_df

 969    def plot_loss_history(self, variable: str = None):
 970        """
 971        Plot training and validation loss evolution per node.
 972
 973        Parameters
 974        ----------
 975        variable : str or None, optional
 976            If provided, plot loss history for this node only. If None, plot
 977            histories for all nodes that have both train and validation logs.
 978
 979        Returns
 980        -------
 981        None
 982
 983        Notes
 984        -----
 985        Two subplots are produced:
 986        - Full epoch history.
 987        - Last 10% of epochs (or only the last epoch if fewer than 5 epochs).
 988        """
 989
 990        histories = self.loss_history()
 991        if not histories:
 992            print("[WARNING] No loss histories found.")
 993            return
 994
 995        # Select which nodes to plot
 996        if variable is not None:
 997            if variable not in histories:
 998                raise ValueError(f"[ERROR] Node '{variable}' not found in histories.")
 999            nodes_to_plot = [variable]
1000        else:
1001            nodes_to_plot = list(histories.keys())
1002
1003        # Filter out nodes with no valid history
1004        nodes_to_plot = [
1005            n for n in nodes_to_plot
1006            if histories[n].get("train") is not None and len(histories[n]["train"]) > 0
1007            and histories[n].get("validation") is not None and len(histories[n]["validation"]) > 0
1008        ]
1009
1010        if not nodes_to_plot:
1011            print("[WARNING] No valid histories found to plot.")
1012            return
1013
1014        plt.figure(figsize=(14, 12))
1015
1016        # --- Full history (top plot) ---
1017        plt.subplot(2, 1, 1)
1018        for node in nodes_to_plot:
1019            node_hist = histories[node]
1020            train_hist, val_hist = node_hist["train"], node_hist["validation"]
1021
1022            epochs = range(1, len(train_hist) + 1)
1023            plt.plot(epochs, train_hist, label=f"{node} - train", linestyle="--")
1024            plt.plot(epochs, val_hist, label=f"{node} - val")
1025
1026        plt.title("Training and Validation NLL - Full History")
1027        plt.xlabel("Epoch")
1028        plt.ylabel("NLL")
1029        plt.legend()
1030        plt.grid(True)
1031
1032        # --- Last 10% of epochs (bottom plot) ---
1033        plt.subplot(2, 1, 2)
1034        for node in nodes_to_plot:
1035            node_hist = histories[node]
1036            train_hist, val_hist = node_hist["train"], node_hist["validation"]
1037
1038            total_epochs = len(train_hist)
1039            start_idx = total_epochs - 1 if total_epochs < 5 else int(total_epochs * 0.9)
1040
1041            epochs = range(start_idx + 1, total_epochs + 1)
1042            plt.plot(epochs, train_hist[start_idx:], label=f"{node} - train", linestyle="--")
1043            plt.plot(epochs, val_hist[start_idx:], label=f"{node} - val")
1044
1045        plt.title("Training and Validation NLL - Last 10% of Epochs (or Last Epoch if <5)")
1046        plt.xlabel("Epoch")
1047        plt.ylabel("NLL")
1048        plt.legend()
1049        plt.grid(True)
1050
1051        plt.tight_layout()
1052        plt.show()
1053
1054    def plot_linear_shift_history(self, data_dict=None, node=None, ref_lines=None):
1055        """
1056        Plot the evolution of linear shift terms over epochs.
1057
1058        Parameters
1059        ----------
1060        data_dict : dict or None, optional
1061            Pre-loaded mapping ``{node_name: pandas.DataFrame}`` containing shift
1062            weights across epochs. If None, `linear_shift_history()` is called.
1063        node : str or None, optional
1064            If provided, plot only this node. Otherwise, plot all nodes
1065            present in ``data_dict``.
1066        ref_lines : dict or None, optional
1067            Optional mapping ``{node_name: list of float}``. For each specified
1068            node, horizontal reference lines are drawn at the given values.
1069
1070        Returns
1071        -------
1072        None
1073
1074        Notes
1075        -----
1076        The function flattens nested list-like entries in the DataFrames to scalars,
1077        converts epoch labels to numeric, and then draws one line per shift term.
1078        """
1079
1080        if data_dict is None:
1081            data_dict = self.linear_shift_history()
1082            if data_dict is None:
1083                raise ValueError("No shift history data provided or stored in the class.")
1084
1085        nodes = [node] if node else list(data_dict.keys())
1086
1087        for n in nodes:
1088            df = data_dict[n].copy()
1089
1090            # Flatten nested lists or list-like cells
1091            def flatten(x):
1092                if isinstance(x, list):
1093                    if len(x) == 0:
1094                        return np.nan
1095                    if all(isinstance(i, (int, float)) for i in x):
1096                        return np.mean(x)  # average simple list
1097                    if all(isinstance(i, list) for i in x):
1098                        # nested list -> flatten inner and average
1099                        flat = [v for sub in x for v in (sub if isinstance(sub, list) else [sub])]
1100                        return np.mean(flat) if flat else np.nan
1101                    return x[0] if len(x) == 1 else np.nan
1102                return x
1103
1104            df = df.applymap(flatten)
1105
1106            # Ensure numeric columns
1107            df = df.apply(pd.to_numeric, errors='coerce')
1108
1109            # Convert epoch labels to numeric
1110            df.columns = [
1111                int(c.replace("epoch_", "")) if isinstance(c, str) and c.startswith("epoch_") else c
1112                for c in df.columns
1113            ]
1114            df = df.reindex(sorted(df.columns), axis=1)
1115
1116            plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
1117            for idx in df.index:
1118                plt.plot(df.columns, df.loc[idx], lw=1.4, label=f"shift_{idx}")
1119
1120            if ref_lines and n in ref_lines:
1121                for v in ref_lines[n]:
1122                    plt.axhline(y=v, color="k", linestyle="--", lw=1.0)
1123                    plt.text(df.columns[-1], v, f"{n}: {v}", va="bottom", ha="right", fontsize=8)
1124
1125            plt.xlabel("Epoch")
1126            plt.ylabel("Shift Value")
1127            plt.title(f"Shift Term History â€” Node: {n}")
1128            plt.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc="upper left", fontsize="small")
1129            plt.tight_layout()
1130            plt.show()
1131
1132    def plot_simple_intercepts_history(self, data_dict=None, node=None,ref_lines=None):
1133        """
1134        Plot the evolution of simple intercept weights over epochs.
1135
1136        Parameters
1137        ----------
1138        data_dict : dict or None, optional
1139            Pre-loaded mapping ``{node_name: pandas.DataFrame}`` containing intercept
1140            weights across epochs. If None, `simple_intercept_history()` is called.
1141        node : str or None, optional
1142            If provided, plot only this node. Otherwise, plot all nodes present
1143            in ``data_dict``.
1144        ref_lines : dict or None, optional
1145            Optional mapping ``{node_name: list of float}``. For each specified
1146            node, horizontal reference lines are drawn at the given values.
1147
1148        Returns
1149        -------
1150        None
1151
1152        Notes
1153        -----
1154        Nested list-like entries in the DataFrames are reduced to scalars before
1155        plotting. One line is drawn per intercept parameter.
1156        """
1157        if data_dict is None:
1158            data_dict = self.simple_intercept_history()
1159            if data_dict is None:
1160                raise ValueError("No intercept history data provided or stored in the class.")
1161
1162        nodes = [node] if node else list(data_dict.keys())
1163
1164        for n in nodes:
1165            df = data_dict[n].copy()
1166
1167            def extract_scalar(x):
1168                if isinstance(x, list):
1169                    while isinstance(x, list) and len(x) > 0:
1170                        x = x[0]
1171                return float(x) if isinstance(x, (int, float, np.floating)) else np.nan
1172
1173            df = df.applymap(extract_scalar)
1174
1175            # Convert epoch labels â†’ numeric
1176            df.columns = [
1177                int(c.replace("epoch_", "")) if isinstance(c, str) and c.startswith("epoch_") else c
1178                for c in df.columns
1179            ]
1180            df = df.reindex(sorted(df.columns), axis=1)
1181
1182            plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
1183            for idx in df.index:
1184                plt.plot(df.columns, df.loc[idx], lw=1.4, label=f"theta_{idx}")
1185            
1186            if ref_lines and n in ref_lines:
1187                for v in ref_lines[n]:
1188                    plt.axhline(y=v, color="k", linestyle="--", lw=1.0)
1189                    plt.text(df.columns[-1], v, f"{n}: {v}", va="bottom", ha="right", fontsize=8)
1190                
1191            plt.xlabel("Epoch")
1192            plt.ylabel("Intercept Weight")
1193            plt.title(f"Simple Intercept Evolution â€” Node: {n}")
1194            plt.legend(bbox_to_anchor=(1.05, 1), loc="upper left", fontsize="small")
1195            plt.tight_layout()
1196            plt.show()

1198    def plot_latents(self, df, variable: str = None, confidence: float = 0.95, simulations: int = 1000):
1199        """
1200        Visualize latent U distributions for one or all nodes.
1201
1202        Parameters
1203        ----------
1204        df : pandas.DataFrame
1205            Input data frame with raw node values.
1206        variable : str or None, optional
1207            If provided, only this node's latents are plotted. If None, all
1208            nodes with latent columns are processed.
1209        confidence : float, optional
1210            Confidence level for QQ-plot bands (0 < confidence < 1).
1211            Default is 0.95.
1212        simulations : int, optional
1213            Number of Monte Carlo simulations for QQ-plot bands. Default is 1000.
1214
1215        Returns
1216        -------
1217        None
1218
1219        Notes
1220        -----
1221        For each node, two plots are produced:
1222        - Histogram of the latent U values.
1223        - QQ-plot with simulation-based confidence bands under a logistic reference.
1224        """
1225        # Compute latent representations
1226        latents_df = self.get_latent(df)
1227
1228        # Select nodes
1229        nodes = [variable] if variable is not None else self.nodes_dict.keys()
1230
1231        for node in nodes:
1232            if f"{node}_U" not in latents_df.columns:
1233                print(f"[WARNING] No latent found for node {node}, skipping.")
1234                continue
1235
1236            sample = latents_df[f"{node}_U"].values
1237
1238            # --- Create plots ---
1239            fig, axs = plt.subplots(1, 2, figsize=(12, 5))
1240
1241            # Histogram
1242            axs[0].hist(sample, bins=50, color="steelblue", alpha=0.7)
1243            axs[0].set_title(f"Latent Histogram ({node})")
1244            axs[0].set_xlabel("U")
1245            axs[0].set_ylabel("Frequency")
1246
1247            # QQ Plot with confidence bands
1248            probplot(sample, dist="logistic", plot=axs[1])
1249            self._add_r_style_confidence_bands(axs[1], sample, dist=logistic,confidence=confidence, simulations=simulations)
1250            axs[1].set_title(f"Latent QQ Plot ({node})")
1251
1252            plt.suptitle(f"Latent Diagnostics for Node: {node}", fontsize=14)
1253            plt.tight_layout(rect=[0, 0.03, 1, 0.95])
1254            plt.show()

1257

1272            helpers (`show_hdag_continous` / `show_hdag_ordinal`).

1277

1281        - For ordinal outcomes, `show_hdag_ordinal` is called.

1287            print("[WARNING] len(df)>1, set: plot_n_rows accordingly")

1293            
1294            elif is_outcome_modelled_ordinal(node, self.nodes_dict):
1295                show_hdag_ordinal(df,node=node,configuration_dict=self.cfg.conf_dict,device=self.device,plot_n_rows=plot_n_rows,**kwargs)
